EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Sandra, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 13, 9 y el menor de 4 meses de nacido, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es artesano. 

Nuestra amiga para salir adelante junto a su esposo  tienen una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  además realizar recargas y vende tarjetas telefónicas, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Su esposo también se dedica a la artesanía las mismas que elabora en un taller que tiene en su misma casa y ella le ayuda de vez en cuando, tiene más de 8 años con su negocio y les va muy bien  ya que cuentan con muy buena clientela.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar víveres y útiles escolares para aprovechar la temporada de entrada a clases. Lleva más de  2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Productivo Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture.   The canton is recognized, both nationally and internationally, for its artisanship and is also the home of the famous Panama Hats.  

Sandra, 38 years old, lives here.  She lives in a civil union and has three children from this relationship, ages 13, 9, and 4 months.  Her older children are in school and her husband is an artisan.  

In order to get ahead, our friend and her husband have a grocery store in their home where they sell all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, legumes, vegetables, and fruits.  In addition, they recharge and sell phone cards.  Sandra works every day from 6:00 am until 8:00 pm, sometimes even later.  Her husband works just as hard creating artisanal crafts in his workshop, also located in their home.  Sandra helps her husband from time to time.  She has had her business for eight years and it is going very well because she has a very good clientele.  

She will use this loan to stock her store.  She is going to buy supplies and school gear to take advantage of the beginning of the school season.  She has been a member of her communal bank for two years and she likes it because of the help given by means of the loans.  Her dream is to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and school gear.

loans.name: René Bertha

texts.es: René es socia del Bancomunal Virgen Del Carmen, tiene 25 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo de 4 años, se dedica a la venta de comida y a la crianza de animales menores para venderlos al por mayor en el mercado. Ella está contenta y agradecida con FINCA Perú porque le enseñaron a ahorrar y a valorarse como mujer trabajadora, le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal, allí su dinero ha aumentado y eso le ayuda a poder invertir más en su negocio. Ella quiere lograr sus metas y una de ellas es comprar y vender tara al por mayor. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de animales menores.
texts.en:
René’s a member of the “Virgen Del Carmen” communal bank.  She’s 25 years old and has a four-year-old son.  She sells food and raises small farm animals to sell at wholesale in the market.  

She’s happy and grateful with FINCA Perú because they taught her how to save and to value herself as a hardworking woman.  She likes attending communal bank meetings; her money has grown there and that helps her to be able to invest more in her business.  

She wants to reach her goals one of which is to buy ‘tara’ [plant from which tara gum powder is made] to sell at wholesale.  She will use the requested loan to buy small farm animals.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals like chickens, ducks, rabbits, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además tiene muchas ideas de negocio e ilusiones de salir adelante. Su pareja es Carlos, quien se dedica a la construcción, y es el padre de sus dos hijos: Carlos de 5 años y Cristian de 20  años. Juntos habitan cómodamente su casa propia.
Su actividad es la venta de mercadería variada como ropa, carteras, muñecos, adornos y productos de belleza por catálogo. Se inició hace más de 3 años, contando con un capital propio, fruto de sus ahorros, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja. Decidió a empezar con esta labor porque quiso apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, además de contar con un oficio y sentirse una persona productiva. 

Este es su préstamo número 14 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera cumplir con sus objetivos. Comenta que está contenta con el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues apoyan a las personas con el financiamiento de sus proyectos.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de mercadería en productos de belleza y regalos para el día de la madre.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40-years-old.  She’s a hardworking, dedicated woman who has many business ideas and hopes to get ahead.  Her partner is Carlos who works in construction and he’s the father of their two children, Carlos, 5 and Cristian, 20.  They live together comfortably in their own house.

Her activity is selling general merchandise like clothes, purses, dolls, decorations and beauty products via catalogue.  She started more than three years ago with her own capital which she had saved and to date has been running it by herself.  She considers her business to be quite profitable because of the profits it produces.  She decided to start this business because she wanted to help her spouse with household expenses as well as to have an occupation and feel like a productive person.

This is her MFP loan #14 so she expects to meet her objectives.  She comments that she’s happy with her communal bank’s work because they support people with financing for their projects.

She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy merchandise consisting in beauty products and Mother’s Day gifts.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 38 years old and married with six children. With five of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a firewood retail business in the Philippines and requested a loan of 18,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock of firewoods to sell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 41 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Magdalena has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Magdalena aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 47 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Melinda has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Melinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Nenita requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Bao Beoneere Group

texts.fr:
Mr ZAKARYA est la responsable du groupe  BAO BEONEERE. Il est marié et père d’un (01) enfant. Il est âgé de 03 ans et  ne  va à l’école .Il a 03 personnes en charge.

Mr vend des articles de boutique alimentaire depuis 02 ans. Il s’approvisionne  au marché de secteur 10  et à Sankariyaré en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes du quartier.

Il veut s’acheter 02 bidons d’huile de 20 litre, 05 cartons de savon, 03 paquets de biscuit et des bonbons. 

Mr utiliser ses économies  pour agrandir son commerce. Il ambitionne  élargir sa boutique, amélioré les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. ZAKARYA is the leader of the group BAO BEONEERE. He is a married father of a 3-year-old child who does not yet go to school. He supports three people.

Mr. Zakarya has been selling foodstuffs for two years. He buys his merchandise at the market of sector 10 and in downtown Sankariyaré. His customers are local men and women. 

He plans to buy two 20-liter jugs of oil, five cartons of soap, three packs of cookies and some candy. 

Mr. Zakarya will use his savings to expand his business. He wants to increase the size of his store and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two 20-liter jugs of oil, five cartons of soap, three packs of cookies and some candy.

loans.name: Ceneida María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ceneida tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  12 y 10 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatillas y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas diarias, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son las zapatillas ya que lleva en modelos muy llamativos para sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatillas, ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es algún día tener una boutique.
texts.en:
Productivo Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and its nationally and internationally known arts and crafts, and as the place of the famous Panama hats.

Here we met Ceneida, 39.  She is married and from this relationship has two children, ages 12 and 10, who are in school.  Her husband is a driver.

Our friend is a housewife who sells clothing, sneakers, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories) to get her own means of support and so help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells door-to-door and works from two to three hours a day three days a week.  She leaves her products on credit and collects every week.  She has been doing this work for eight years and it is going very well for her.  She tells us that what she sells most is sneakers because she carries them in styles that are very attractive to her customers.

This loan is to buy sneakers, clothing, perfume, creams, and cosmetics, among other things.  This is her fourth cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because it is easy to make the payments.

Her dream is to have a boutique one day.

loans.use: to buy sneakers, clothing, perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith tiene 60 años, es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, además de alegre y sociable. Está casada  con Neemías, el padre de sus hijos; vive en con él, con su hija Gady de 31 años, sus dos nietos y tres 3 sobrinos a quienes apoyan con su educación.
Tiene un negocio familiar que realiza con su hija, siendo ella la administradora. Compran y venden pescado al por mayor enviándolo a otras ciudades donde la demanda es mayor. Hace más de 20 años que empezó por iniciativa propia, cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien la trasporta al puerto para realizar la compra de su mercadería y la llevan al mercado para venderlo, realizando sólo entregas a pedido. Le gusta su actividad por el ingreso económico que les ayuda a solventar los gastos del hogar. Adicionalmente, tiene una bodega en su casa que atiende su hija, les va bien. Por eso tiene planes de continuar y ampliar su negocio.

Este es su préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores, y tener un buen record crediticio. Comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que se brindan entre todos.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más pescado fresco, buscando conseguir precios más bajos por su compra en volumen, así tener mayores ganancias. También realizará la compra de abarrotes para su bodega.
texts.en:
Judith, 60, is a dedicated, hardworking woman besides being cheerful and sociable.  She’s married to Neemías, her children’s father.  She lives with him, her daughter Gady, 31, her two grandchildren and three nephews she supports with their education.

She has a family business with her daughter that she administers.  They buy and sell fish at wholesale and send it to other cities where demand is higher.  She started this on her own initiative more than 20 years ago and she gets help from her spouse who takes her to the port to buy the merchandise and then take it to the market to sell it; they only deliver based on prior orders.  She likes her activity because the income helps her cover household expenses.  In addition, she also has a store at home that her daughter runs; they do well which is why she has plans to continue and expand her business.

This is her MFP loan #12 so she expects to meet her objectives.  She promises to be responsible with her installment payments like with prior loans and to have a good credit history.  She comments that she’s comfortable in her communal bank because of the support they give each other.

She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more fresh fish looking for lower prices by purchasing in volume so that profits will be greater.  She will also buy groceries for her store.

loans.use: to buy fish.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuevo Horizonte está constituido por mujeres  muy activas y muy trabajadoras quienes han sobresalido siempre en todos los ciclos por su dinamismo y unidad.
La Sra. Magdalena es miembro del grupo, ella ayuda a mantener un equilibrio y unidad entre todas las integrantes, ya que la misma trabaja incansable con el fin de darles una vida mejor a sus hijos.  Ella se dedica a la costura, y comenta que trabaja todos los días incansablemente para que de esa forma pueda dar lo mejor a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, cierres y demás insumos para que de esa forma pueda seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The group "Nuevo Horizonte" (New Horizon) consists of active and hardworking women who always want to excel in each of their loan cycles with excitement and unity.

Sra. Magdalena is a member of the group. She helps out by maintaining balance and unity among all of the members. Magdalena works tirelessly in order to provide her children with a better quality of life. She is a seamstress and says that she works constantly in order to provide the best for her family. Magdalena is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, rubber, zippers, and other supplies that will enable her to continue working.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, rubber, zippers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 61 años, es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, además de amable y cordial. Está casada con Pablo, quien se dedica a la construcción, y es el padre de sus  hijos. Vive con su esposo; su hijo Pablo, de 28 años, y un nieto; a los que quiere mucho.

Su actividad es la venta de ropa de segundo uso, para lo cual realiza viajes mensuales a la capital donde hace las compras, buscando los mejores precios, para luego venderla entre sus vecinos y amistades. Realiza este negocio hace más de 2 años y hasta el momento lo hace sola, sólo en ocasiones son sus hijos los que viajan a traer los fardos de ropa. Considera su negocio bastante rentable, pues en las zonas alejadas de la ciudad es donde obtiene mejores ganancias.
Con este negocio ha logrado educar a sus hijos, de los cuales se siente orgullosa de haberlos sacado adelante.

Este es su préstamo número 14 con la institución MFP, por ello espera concretar sus planes. Se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera que es un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más ropa de segundo uso en fardos grandes.
texts.en:
Juana, 61, is a dedicated, hardworking woman besides being kind and cordial.  She’s married to Pablo who works in construction and is the father of her children.  She lives with her husband, her son Pablo, 28, and a grandson; she loves them very much.

Her activity is selling used clothes.  To do so she makes monthly trips to the capital to do her purchases looking for better prices to then sell among her friends and neighbors.  She’s been in business more than two years and to date does it alone; occasionally her children are the ones that travel to bring the bundles of clothes.  She considers her business to be quite profitable; she makes the best profits in areas away from the city.  She managed to educate her children thanks to this business and she feels proud for having moved them forward.

This is her MFP loan #14 so she expects to make her plans a reality.  She feels comfortable in her communal bank because she considers that it’s a united, mutually supportive group.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more large bundles of used clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Carmi

texts.es:
Carmi tiene 33 años, es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, además de amable y cordial. Está casada con Jerson, quien se dedica al transporte, y es el padre de sus tres hijos: Judith de 12, Jesmin de 8 y Daviel de 4 años de edad. La casa donde viven es propia.
Su actividad es la venta de ropa, para lo cual realiza viajes periódicos a la capital, donde realiza sus compras buscando los mejores precios y modelos, en ocasiones es su prima quien le envía la ropa, pues vive en esa ciudad. También vende productos de belleza por catálogo, siendo sus principales clientes sus amistades, familiares y las colegas del centro educativo donde trabaja como docente. Estos negocios los realiza desde hace más de 3 años, y le gusta porque genera sus propios ingresos económicos adicionales para solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de su hija. Antes tenía problemas económicos, pues sólo con su sueldo no le alcanzaba.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por ello espera a concretar sus planes. Además se siente a gusto con banco comunal al que pertenece, pues los considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más ropa y productos de belleza, aumentando su stock de mercadería.
texts.en:
Carmi, 33, is a dedicated, hardworking woman besides being kind and cordial.  She’s married to Jerson who works in transportation and is the father of their three children: Judith, 12, Jesmin, 8 and Daniel, 4. The house they live in is their property.

Her activity is selling clothes.  To do so she makes periodic trips to the capital where she does her purchases looking for better prices and styles.  
Sometimes her cousin sends her clothes since she lives in that city.  She also sells beauty products via catalogue her main customers being her friends, family members and coworkers at the school she works at as a teacher.  She’s been in business more than three years and likes it because she earns her own additional income to cover household expenses and her daughter’s educational costs.  She used to have more economic problems because her salary was insufficient.

This is her second MFP loan so she hopes to make her plans a reality.   She also feels comfortable in the communal bank she belongs to because she considers them to be a united, mutually supportive group.

She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more clothes and beauty products increasing her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Marlene Monserrate

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar v ive la señora Marlene, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres niñas de 10, 9 y 4 años de edad, las dos mayores están en escuela. El marido es se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Nuestra amiga  trabaja en sociedad con su hermano, ellos tienen un negocio de venta de frutas como: sandias, melón,  pepino, etc. Su forma de trabajar es la siguiente, ellos compran a agricultores de la zona y luego todas las mañanas se desplazan hasta el mercado en la ciudad de Portoviejo para vender tanto al por mayor como al menudeo. Trabajan de lunes a sabados desde las 5h00 hasta las 14h00, dice que lleva ya algunos años que se dedican a esto y que gracias a este negocio a podido mejorar su calidad de vida.

Este crédito es para comprar melones, sandias, pepinos y otras frutas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 7 años  y le gusta por el apoyo y ayuda que ha recibido en todos estos años.
 
Sus sueños son mejorar su casa y algún dia comprar un carro pues fletan cada vez que realizan su viajes.
texts.en:
The members of Mejorando el Futuro Communal Bank meet every two weeks in a town called Tierras Amarillas in Rocafuerte Canton.  This area is known for its agriculture because a large number of residents work in short-cycle farming.

Marlene lives here.  She is 35 years old and has a common-law relationship from which she has three daughters, ages 10, 9, and 4.  The two oldest are in school.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Our friend works with her brother.  They have a business selling fruit such as watermelons, melons, cucumbers, etc.  Her work method is the following: They buy from farmers in the area and then go to the market in the city of Portoviejo every morning to sell both wholesale and retail.  They work from Monday through Saturday from 5:00 until 2:00.  She says she has been doing this work for several years already and that she has been able to improve her quality of life thanks to this business.

This loan is to buy melons, watermelons, cucumbers, and other fruit.  She has been in the communal bank for seven years and she likes it for the support and help she has received throughout the years.

Her dreams are to improve her house and to buy a car someday because they rent every time they make a trip.

loans.use: to buy melons, watermelons, cucumbers, and other fruit.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 52 años, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, también es amable y cordial en su trato. Está casada con José, el padre de sus hijos, que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Vive cómodamente en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo y recibiendo la visita de sus hijos y nietos.

Su actividad es la venta de bebidas, cuenta con una pequeña fuente de soda que está instalada en su vivienda, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, contando con una refrigeradora que compró con el apoyo de su esposo. Se inicio hace más de 5 años con un préstamo bancario,  comprando en pequeñas cantidades y luego fue creciendo poco a poco. Hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola, pero en ocasiones la visitan sus hijas y le ayudan a atender a sus clientes.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, ya que es muy visitada por sus fieles clientes. Decidió empezar con su negocio por el deseo de contar con un oficio y generarse sus propios ingresos económicos desde la comodidad de su hogar, pues tiene una enfermedad en la espalda que no la deja pararse erguida, caminando inclinada.

Este es su préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP y se siente agradecida de saber que cuenta con un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Comenta sentirse bien en banco comunal, pues es un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más bebidas de diversos sabores al por mayor, esperando así aumentar su capital y tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
María, 52, is a woman who likes to work; she’s also kind and cordial with people.  She’s married to José, the father of her children who are all independent adults now.  She lives comfortably in her own house with her husband and is visited by her children and grandchildren.

Her activity is selling beverages.  She has a small soda fountain at home where she kindly takes care of her customers.  She has a refrigerator there she got with help from her husband.  She started out more than five years ago with a bank loan buying small amounts and gradually growing.  To date, she’s been working alone but occasionally her daughters visit her and help her take care of customers.

She considers the business to be quite profitable because of the profits it produces since she’s visited quite a bit by her loyal customers.  She decided to start her business wanting to have an occupation and to generate her own income from the comfort of her own home because she has a problem with her back that prevents her from standing up straight; she walks bent over.

This is her MFP loan #6 and she feels grateful to know that she can count on financial support to make her plans a reality.  She comments that she feels good in her communal bank because it’s a united, mutually supportive group.

She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more beverages in various flavors at wholesale hoping thus to increase her capital and to have more profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Deisy Fiorella

texts.es:
Deisy es una joven d e18 años de edad la cual es muy entusiasta y sobre todo tiene mucho optimismo, vive al lado de su madre y abuela a quienes quiere mucho y por ello trabaja y estudia a la vez, ya que ella apoya en casa y sobre todo porque quiere ser una profesional y un orgullo para su familia. Su vivienda se encuentra en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, además es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y también porque sus pobladores tiene un don con la preparación de los platillos ya que todo lo que cocinan resulta muy delicioso; por ello uno de los platos favoritos de Deisy es el riquísimo  “Arroz con Pato”. Con el fruto de su trabajo Deisy está estudiando la carrera de Auxiliar contable, pero le gustaría mas adelante estudiar en la Universidad.

Día a día Deisy trabaja como auxiliar contable en un hospedaje de su ciudad, trabaja alrededor de 9 horas, ya que por las noches va a sus clases en un Instituto de su ciudad, ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo y sus estudios porque es muy responsable y porque es honrada y sobre todo amable.

Deisy está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo ella podrá ayudar a su abuela ya que ella tiene una enfermedad y necesita comprar medicinas y consultas medicas de tratamiento; de esta manera ella podrá apoyar a su abuela en mejorarse y que tenga una mejor calidad de vida; así ella podrá seguir luchando para darle una vida mejor y hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar en la Universidad”.
texts.en:
Deisy is a young woman who is 18 years of age. She is very enthusiastic and optimistic. Deisy lives with her mother and grandmother, who she loves dearly. At the moment, Deisy is working and studying. She is already supporting the household, but she wants to become a professional and make her family proud. Her home is located in the city of Chincha, which is known for its warm climate. It is also the site of the greatest victories in Peruvian sports. The inhabitants have a gift for preparing dishes that result in delicious flavor. One of Deisy's favorite dishes is "arroz con pato" (duck with rice). With what she earns from her job, Deisy is able to study for a degree in Accounting, but she would like to continue on to an advanced degree at the university.

Each day Deisy works as an assistant bookkeeper at a lodge in the city. She works approximately nine hours and then attends classes at night at an institute in her city. Deisy believes she is doing well in her job and in her studies because she is responsible, honest, and friendly.

Deisy is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their overwhelming support, she will be able to help her grandmother who has an illness and needs medicines and medical treatment consultations. This will enable Deisy to help her grandmother improve so that she can have a better quality of life. She also continues to strive for a better life for herself and to fulfill her greatest dream of studying at the university.

loans.use: to pay for her grandmother's medicines and treatment.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Isidro” es un grupo muy trabajador y unido, las integrantes siempre trabajan juntas y tratan de ayudarse siempre las unas a las otras. La meta de cada una de ellas es poder ayudar a sus familias e ir mejorando sus ingresos.
Heriberta es parte de este grupo, ella nos comenta que tiene un copetín bien surtido con todo tipo de productos. Heriberta comenta que gracias a su pequeño negocio ha podido ayudar a su familia y de esa forma poder darles lo que necesitan para poder cubrir los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito ya que desea poder abastecer su copetín con galletitas, gaseosas, jugos, caramelos y demás productos ya que son los que mas salida tienen todos los días. Agradecen todas por la ayuda que están recibiendo, ya que toda ayuda que reciban les es muy útil.
texts.en:
The "San Isidiro" committee is a very solid and hardworking group.  The members always work together and always try to help one another.  The goal of all the members is to be able to help their families and improve their incomes.

Heriberta is part of this group.  She tells us that she has a shop that is well-stocked with all types of products.  She says that thanks to her small business she has been able to help her family and give them what they need in order to cover the household expenses.

She is seeking this loan since she wants to be able to stock her shop with cookies, sodas, juices, candies and more products, since these are her most popular offerings.  She thanks everyone for all the support she is receiving, since it is all very helpful.

loans.use: to buy cookies, sodas, juices, candies and other products.

loans.name: Sebe Allah Ye Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZOURATA est la responsable du groupe SEBE ALLAH YE. Elle est mariée et mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 19 ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Mme est restauratrice depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de toecin. Ses clients sont les habitants du quartier.

Elle veut s’acheter 03 sacs de riz, ½ sac d’haricot, ½ sac de pois de terre et 01 bidon d’huile de 20 litre.
 
Mme utilise ses économies  pour agrandir son commerce de restauration. Elle ambitionne  amélioré les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zourata is the leader of the Sebe Allah Ye group. She is married and the mother of five. The eldest is 19 years old, and the youngest seven. Two of her children are in school. She has five dependents. For the last 10 years, Zourata has been cooking food for sale. She stocks up at the market of Toecin. Her customers are neighborhood locals.

She would like to buy three bags of rice, half a bag of beans, half a bag of groundnuts and one 20-liter jug of vegetable oil. Zoura uses her savings to expand her food business. Her goal is to improve her family’s life conditions.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice, half a bag of beans, half a bag of groundnuts and one 20-liter jug of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 46 años, es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, además de ser muy alegre y amable.  Está casado con María quien se dedica a la costura y es madre de su hijo Pablo, de 30 años de edad. Vive en compañía de su pareja e hijo más su nuera y un nieto, a los que quiere mucho, habitando en su casa propia.

La actividad que él realiza es la comercialización de abarrotes, artículos de librería, medicamentos y otros. Para esto abrió una pequeña tienda en su propia casa, desde donde atiende las necesidades de sus vecinos, quienes son sus principales clientes. También se dedica a la venta de comida rápida por las noches, contando con el apoyo de su pareja. Se inició hace más de 4 años, tiempo que viene funcionando su tienda. Considera a su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja, ya que por la zona no hay más personas que tengan este negocio y la variedad de productos que ofrece. Le gusta su actividad porque atiende al público, con los que socializa, así se distrae y se siente un hombre productivo, con lo que logra pagar los gastos del hogar, ya que tenía la necesidad de ampliar sus ingresos. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados tiene planea ampliar y abrir un puesto de venta de mayor volumen en el mercado municipal que pronto se inaugurará.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de poder contar el apoyo financiero. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 4000 nuevos soles, invertirá la mitad en la compra de comestibles de primera necesidad, y el saldo lo mantendrá para inversiones futuras que se presenten.
texts.en:
Javier, 46, is a hardworking and enterprising man, as well as being very happy and kind.  He is married to María, who is a seamstress and the mother of their son Pablo, 30.  He lives in his own house with his wife and son plus his daughter-in-law and a grandson, whom he loves very much.

He sells groceries, bookstore supplies, medicine, and other things.  He opened a small store for this in his own house, from where he sees to the needs of his neighbors, who are his main customers.  He also sells fast food at night with the help of his partner.  He started more than four years ago, during which time he has been running his store.  He considers the business profitable for the profits it gives him, because there are no other people in the area with this business and the variety of products he sells.

He likes his job because he attends to the public, with whom he socializes.  In this way he amuses himself and feels like a productive man.  He manages to pay for the household expenses, because he needed to increase his income.  For that reason he plans to expand and open a wholesale stall that will open soon in the town market.

This is his third loan with MFP.  He is happy about being able to have financial support, so he promises to make his payments on time.

With the requested amount of 4000 nuevos soles [PEN], he will invest half in buying convenience food items and save the balance for future investments that might come up.

loans.use: to expand his merchandise.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es:
Norma tiene 29 años de edad, está casada desde hace 7 años y vive junto a su esposo y una hija de 6 años en una aldea perteneciente al municipio de Morazan, Yoro.
Norma, es muy emprendedora ella hace 5 años se dedico junto con su esposo a cultivar maíz, ya que su esposo recibió una herencia de un terreno y han aprovechado para cultivar, el maíz es un alimento básico en nuestra población y tiene gran demanda. También tiene establecida una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios y tiene la oportunidad de vender el maíz más rápido. Este negocio le genera buenas ganancias lo que le ha motivado para realizar esta actividad. Esta solicitando un préstamo por L.6,000.00 para preparar la tierra donde va cultivar maíz, comprara fertilizantes y gastos de limpieza de la misma. Su meta es ampliar el área de cultivo para tener mayores ganancias.
Norma pertenece al grupo solidario Bendicion del señor, que esta formado por 4 integrantes.
texts.en:
Norma is 29 years old and has been married for nine years. She lives with her husband and her 6-year-old daughter in a village located in the municipality of Morazan, Yoro.

Norma is very hardworking. Five years ago she started making a living planting corn with her husband as he had received land in an inheritance. They have taken this opportunity to farm. Corn is a basic foodstuff in the region and there is a large demand for it. She also has a small grocery store where she sells food products and is able to sell her corn more quickly. This business makes a good profit which is what drove her to start the business. 

She is requesting a loan of 6,000.00 lempiras to prepare the land for planting corn, to buy fertilizers, and to pay the costs of clearing the land. Her goals is expand the amount of land planted so she can make a better income. Norma is part of a solidarity group called Bendicion del Señor which is made up of four members.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting corn, to buy fertilizers and to pay for clearing.

loans.name: Armando José

texts.es:
El Señor Armando José es casado y labora para la empresa de acueductos y alcantarillado desde hace 6 años  trabajo con lo que ha desarrollado su familia.
Una de las necesidades que atraviesa el señor  Armando es la de construir un cuarto en su casa ya que la familia ha ido crecido y siente la necesidad de tener más espacio para él y su familia, Por eso visitó Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito buscando siempre el bienestar de él y de su familia.
texts.en: Armando José is married and has worked for a water and drainage firm for six years, a job with which he’s raised his family.  One of the needs Armando is going through is to build a room in his house because the family has grown and he sees the need for more space for him and his family which is why he visited Ceprodel to be benefitted by a loan always seeking his and his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement, rebar, metal sheeting, purlines.

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
Baby Jane is 25 years old and single. For the past three years, she has run a fishing business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Baby Jane is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials, such as a fishing net, for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and materials

loans.name: Ella

texts.en: Ella is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Ella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, biscuits, sugar, candies, soap, and other groceries. In the future Ella would like to buy a tricycle for her husband's business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie works hard to support her family. Margie is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for fishing. Margie has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for fishing

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 32 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Norma has a fishing business in the Philippines. Norma requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other materials for fishing. Norma has been in this business for two years. In the future, Norma would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 59 años, es un buen hombre y amable. Junto a su pareja tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales cuatro ya son mayores e independientes, solo el último, de 20 años, vive con ellos; además de su nieto, a quienes a diario brinda lo mejor, en la casa que pudo obtener con mucho esfuerzo.
Su trabajo es la construcción, su especialidad son los galpones para pollos, corrales y granjas. También se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, esta actividad la realiza a lado de su esposa, mientras que el de la construcción lo hace a lado de algunos obreros que contrata. Luego del pago al personal y el gasto en materiales gana un promedio del 35% de su inversión. Lleva trabajando con este negocio por 15 años y espera seguir haciéndolo por más tiempo. Le gusta mucho trabajar en esta actividad, ya que gana bien, le permite tener tiempo para algunas otras cosas y le da la estabilidad que necesita para tener una vida tranquila. Tiene como objetivo ampliar sus galpones y criar sus aves en mayor cantidad.

Este es su crédito número 8 con MFP, por tanto espera cumplir con sus objetivos. Además se compromete, una vez más, a apagar sus cutas de manera puntual y responsable, como en los créditos anteriores que tuvo. Está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son buenos y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 2000 soles, comprará más pollos bebé, mejorará sus galpones y comprará alimento balanceado. A su vez, adquirirá materiales y herramientas para seguir haciendo su trabajo de construcción.
texts.en:
Ángel, 59, is a kind, good man.  He and his wife have five children four of which are already independent adults.  Only the youngest 20-year-old as well as his grandson still live with them; he gives them the best every day in the house he was able to obtain with much effort.

His work is construction and his specialty is chicken coops, corrals and farms.  He also raises barnyard fowl, an activity he carries out alongside his wife, while the construction is done alongside some laborers he hires.  After paying laborers and for supplies, he earns on average a profit of 35% on his investment.  He’s been working in this business for 15 years and hopes to continue to do so for more time.  He likes working in this activity very much because he earns well and it leaves him time for other things; it gives him the stability needed to have a tranquil life.  His goal is to enlarge his chicken coops and to raise animals in larger numbers.

This is MFP loan #8 so he hopes to reach his objectives.  He also commits once more to make his installment payments in a punctual, responsible way like in previous loans he’s had.  He’s very happy to belong to his communal bank because all the members are good and mutually supportive.

He will use the requested 2000 soles to buy more baby chicks, to improve his coops and to buy nutritionally balanced feed.  At the same time, he will acquire materials and tools to continue doing his construction work.

loans.use: to buy more chicks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years and is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business. In addition, Veronica earns income from food vending.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Decio

texts.es:
Decio tiene 33 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Todos los días sueña con poder surgir y brindarles una buena calidad de vida a sus padres, con quienes vive.
Realiza varias actividades. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad durante el día. Ahí mismo funciona su disco bar, donde ofrece a sus clientes buena música, bebidas heladas y algunos snacks. Por la noche, los fines de semana, vende comida en su casa. Y por último, cuando le solicitan, también hace trabajos de corte de pelo y peinados.
Todas estas actividades las hace solo, desde hace 5 años. Le gusta mucho trabajo y le va muy bien. Tiene muchos planes para el futuro, pero por el momento sólo desea mantener sus negocios e incrementar sus ganancias.

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, y estar seguro de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 2000 soles, comprará bebidas y abarrotes para su tienda y bar; materiales para su peluquería, e ingredientes para seguir preparando sus comidas.
texts.en:
Decio, 33, is single and has no children. Every day he dreams with being able to surge forward and provide a good quality of life for his parents with whom he lives.

He does a variety of activities. He has a grocery store where he sells basic staple items during the day.  His disco bar also functions there where he provides his customers with good music, cold drinks and some snacks.  At night and on weekends he sells food at home and finally, when requested he also does haircuts and hairstyling.

He’s been doing all these activities alone for the last five years.  He likes his work very much and he does very well.  He has many plans for the future but for the moment all he wants is to maintain his businesses and increase his profits.

This will be his sixth MFP loan.  He’s very happy to know that he will have financial support and be sure to make progress with his business.  On the other hand, he commits once more to make his installment payments like he’s done with previous loans.  In addition, it pleases him to be part of his communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.

He will use the requested 2000 soles to buy beverages and groceries for his store and bar and barbering supplies and ingredients to continue making his food.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 49-year-old widow with four children from Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. In order to make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a business venture. The business venture consists of planting and harvesting coconuts for sell. Evangeline has been in her business for 5 years and earns 12,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Evangeline joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 16,100 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and to pay for labor cost for farm maintenance. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for the labor costs for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Yulin

texts.en:
Yulin is 40 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. For the past five years, she has been running a tailoring business in the Philippines. Yulin is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Yulin is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her dress-making business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for making dresses

loans.name: Eriot

texts.en:
Eriot is 44 years old and lives in the town of Kireka, in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 15 years, Eriot has been working hard to manage his market business where he sells fresh food such as maize and sweet potatoes. 

To help expand his business, Eriot is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more fresh food like maize to sell. His loan will help Eriot generate greater profits and increase his income.  In the future, he hopes that he will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Eriot is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eriot who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel tiene 47 años, es un buen hombre, amable y que trabaja mucho para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Está casado y tiene tres hijos de 12, 9 y 5 años, ellos son su razón de vivir y de tanto esfuerzo y trabajo. Vive en la casa que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio junto a su esposa.
Su trabajo es el transporte de carga y de pasajeros dentro y fuera de la ciudad en su motocarro. Al principio trabajaba en un motocarro alquilaba, pero trabajaba mucho y ganaba poco, pues la mayor parte de sus ingresos eran para pagar el alquiler del vehículo. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 20 años y está muy feliz de haber logrado muchas cosas, como la estabilidad de su familia y darles educación a sus hijos. Le está yendo bien, tiene la ventaja de tener dos ingresos económicos, ya que también trabaja como instructor de pesas en el instituto peruano de deportes. Tiene muchos planes para futuro y está decidido a trabajar duro para lograrlos, uno de ellos es comprar un motocarro más.

Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Está muy comprometido con el banco comunal al que pertenece, además está convencido que será un buen cliente, puntual y responsable en sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará piezas para su vehículo, pagará al mecánico que le hará todo el trabajo y arreglará algunas cosas que necesita en su casa para darle seguridad a su cochera.
texts.en: Abel is 47 years old. He is a good and friendly man who works hard in order to provide his family with a better life. He is married with three children, aged 5, 9 and 12. They are his reason of living and for all his hard work and effort. He lives in his own house, which he was able to buy with a great deal of sacrifice together with his wife. His job is to transport cargo and passengers to and from the city in his three-wheeled motorcycle. At first he rented a motorcycle for this purpose, but he was working a lot and making little money, since the majority of his earnings went toward the rent of his vehicle. He has been doing this work for more than twenty years, and is very happy to have achieved a lot of things, such as stability for his family and being able to give an education to his children. Things are going well, as he has the advantage of having two sources of income; he also works as a weightlifting instructor in the Peruvian institute of sports. He has many plans for the future and has decided to work hard in order to achieve them; one of these goals is to buy a second motorcycle. This is his sixth loan with MFP, which he hopes will help him continue to make progress toward his goals. He is very trusted by the communal bank to which he belongs, and is confident that he will be punctual and responsible with his repayments. The funds he is seeking, 1000 soles, will be for the purchase of parts for his vehicle, the labor of the mechanic who will do the work, and the repair of several things in his house that relate to the security of his motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair his three-wheeled motorcycle.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana tiene 30, es una mujer muy emprendedora. Junto a su pareja tiene dos hijos de 5 años y el menor de un año. Vive en casa de los padres de su pareja, donde día a día comparten la alegría de educar y ver crecer a sus hijos y por quienes se esfuerzan al máximo para brindarles lo mejor.
Se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, acondicionó un espacio donde armó un pequeño galpón y ahí tiene a sus pollos. Ya realizó su primera crianza, de donde salieron a la venta una cantidad de 50 y le fue bien. Ella está en proceso de aprendizaje sobre esta actividad y espera que le siga yendo bien, pues  tiene grandes expectativas. Le gusta mucho realizar esta actividad, pues le permite realizar muchas otras cosas y tiene tiempo suficiente para ver a sus menores hijos. Hace algunos meses, antes de empezar con esta actividad, estaba con algunos problemas económicos en su hogar, pero a raíz de la primera producción mejoró. Ahora está con más ganas y espera consolidarse rápidamente y seguir creciendo.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un respaldo financiero, ya que le dará la garantía de seguir trabajando tranquila. Por su parte, está comprometida en seguir siendo una socia puntual en sus cuotas, así como lo fue en anteriores créditos. Además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 3500 soles, comprará pollos bebé, vitaminas, alimentos balanceados y algunos materiales que le hace faltan para implementar bien su galpón.
texts.en:
Diana, 30, is a very enterprising woman.  She and her spouse have two children who are 5 years and 1-year-old.  She lives in her spouse’s parents’ house where day to day they share the joy of educating and watching their children, for whom they strive to the maximum to provide with the best, grow.

She works raising barnyard fowl.  She set up a space where she built a small coop where she keeps her chicks.  She’s already completed her first batch from which she got 50 to sell; she did well.  She’s still in the learning phase of this business and hopes to continue to do well because her expectations are high.  She likes doing this very much because it allows her to do many other things and she has sufficient time to watch over her small children.  A few months ago before starting this activity she had some economic problems at home but thanks to the first production things have improved.  Now she’s even more eager and hopes to quickly establish herself and continue to grow.

This is her MFP loan #5.  She’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial backing because it will guarantee being able to continue working in peace.  On her part, she’s committed to continue to be a punctual member with her payments like she was with previous loans.  In addition, she’s very happy to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive.

She will use the requested 3500 soles to buy baby chicks, vitamins and nutritionally balanced feed as well as some materials she needs to set up her coop well.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.ru: Абдучаббор проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает аудио и видео технику. В этой области он 16 лет. Кредит берет для покупки дисков и флешек.
texts.en:
Abdujabbor lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 41 years old and married. He has four children. He rents a retail outlet where he sells audio and video equipment. He has worked in this area for 16 years. 

Abdujabbor takes a loan for the purchase of CDs and flash drives.

loans.use: to purchase CDs and flash drives for selling in his store

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is a 56-year-old married woman with three children from Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. In order to make a living, she owns and operates a manufacturing business, which sells specially manufactured products to local businesses and community members. Presentacion has been in her business for 8 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Presentacion joined GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials in order to manufacture additional products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in order to manufacture additional products.

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Genesie

texts.en:
Genesie is married and runs a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She has run her business for the past 10 years and she works hard to support her family. 

Genesie is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy tools and spare parts to repair her tricycle. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts to repair her tricycle

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 36 years-old, married and blessed with four children aged 17, 15, five and three years respectively.  She runs a retail shop, a business she started five years ago and she earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She has requested for a first loan of KES 30,000 in order to purchase six bales of baking flour, Pampers, boxes of salt and four crates of soda. 

The profit she earns would be invested back into her business. Her dream is to one day own a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase six bales of baking flour, Pampers, boxes of salt and four crates of soda.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo De Colon Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “El Esfuerzo de Colon” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de empanadas, venta de ropa, artículos plásticos, almacén, venta de pan amasado, feriantes, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Francisca, secretaria del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una polera azul, encima lleva puesto un chaleco color negro, usa anteojos y su cabello lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente a la venta de ropa usada, desde hace 1 año, trabaja desde su casa.
Su mercadería la compra en Santiago. Con el crédito comprará más ropa para todas las edades y personas. 
Sus metas son poder tener un puesto en la feria, para generar mayores ingresos, así optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Francisca vive junto a sus dos hijas, de 23 y 27 años quienes se encuentran trabajando. 
Sus sueños son poder tener un puesto en el persa, vendiendo ropa nueva.
Francisca está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “El Esfuerzo de Colon” (The Spirit of Colon) and has 17 entrepreneurs who are active in different trades, including sales of stuffed buns, clothing, plastics, groceries, bread dough, plus stallholders, services, and others. They all live in San Bernardo in Santiago city.

Francisca, secretary of the communal bank group, who in the photo is seated in the 1st row, second from the left, wearing a blue polo shirt under a black jacket, with glasses and her hair is 'tomado'. She is a merchant who has been selling used clothing for roughly 1 year from her own home. She buys her merchandise in Santiago. With her loan, Francisca will buy more clothing for persons of all ages. Her goals are to be able to have a stall in the market, and to generate a larger income, and thus obtain a better quality of life.

Francisca lives with her 2 daughters, aged 23 and 27, who are both working. Her dreams are to acquire a stall in the Persa market, to sell new clothes. Francisca is very content and grateful for the loan and services offered by Fondo Esperanza. In addition, she feels very comfortable with the reunions and her communal bank group because of the generosity and unity.

San Bernardo is a city located 18 kilometers on a straight line to the south from the Plaza de Armas in Santiago (Chile's capital). It is well known as the folklore capital, since every year, in January, they hold the “Festival Internacional del Folklore” (International Folklore Festival) there. At this event, the roots of the country are recognized and musical groups from all of South America attend. Also, they hold the “Feria de Artesania Tradicional” (Traditional Artisan Festival), in which artisans from Chile and surrounding countries participate. Later, in April, they also have an event called “Abril Cuecas Mil”, which consists of Cueca dancing (a traditional Chilean dance) all around the town.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to people of all ages.

loans.name: Edward

texts.es:
Edwar tiene 44 años, es un hombre trabajador, bueno y muy responsable. Junto a su pareja tiene tres hijos de 19, 18 y 16 años. Todos los días trabaja duro para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. La casa donde viven es propia y fue el resultado de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.
Se dedica a la siembra de frutos cítricos. Tiene una chacra donde empezó hace 16 años, al principio tenía sólo unos cuantos plantones de cítricos, pero poco a poco y con bastante esfuerzo fue sembrando uno a uno y así fue creciendo. Además de esta actividad, tiene un ingreso adicional con la venta de bebidas (cerveza) en su casa, las cuales solo vende a personas mayores de edad. Lo bueno de su trabajo, menciona, es que puede disponer de su tiempo. Antes de esto se dedicaba a trabajar para otras personas y eso no le permitía tener muchas ganancias, ahora está mejor y desea establecerse mejor.

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por tanto está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1500 soles, comprará más bebidas para seguir vendiendo. También adquirirá herramientas para realizar la limpieza de sus tierras y contratará a algunas personas que le ayuden con el trabajo.
texts.en:
Edward, 44, is a hardworking, good, very responsible man.  He and his wife have three children who are 19, 18 and 16 years old.  He works hard every day to provide them with a better quality of life.  The house they live in his property and was the result of much effort and work.

He grows citrus fruit.  He has a field he started 16 years ago.  At first he had just a few citric plants but gradually and with much effort he planted one by one and grew.  In addition to this activity he has an additional income producing business: he sells beverages (beer) at home that he sells only to adults.  He mentions that what’s good about his work is that he can manage his own time.  Before this he used to work for others and that didn’t produce much profit; he’s better now and he’d like to be even better still.

This is his fifth loan with MFP and he’s very happy to know that he’ll have financial support to advance with his business.  He commits once more to make his installment payments like he did with the previous loans he got.  He’s happy to belong to his communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive.

He will use the requested 1500 soles to buy beverages to sell.  He’ll also acquire tools to clear his fields and hire some people to help him with the work.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Aura Vanessa

texts.es:
Señora Aura Vanessa es una profesional de la medicina y se desempeña como profesora titular docente en una universidad en el departamento de León desde hace 3 años siendo este trabajo el sustento de su familia.

La señora Aura Vanessa por su trabajo tiene que trasladarse de un lado hacia otro ella posee su propio medio de transporte pero con el tiempo se le a deteriorado las llantas de su vehículo por lo que se acerco a ceprodel solicitando un crédito ya que con sus propios ingresos se le hacia un poco imposible comprarla.
texts.en:
Aura Vanessa is a medical professional who has worked for three years as a teaching professor in a university in the department of León.  This job supports her family.

Aura Vanessa has to travel for her job.  She has her own means of transportation but over time her tires have deteriorated.  She approached CEPRODEL to request a loan because it was a little impossible to buy them with her own income.

loans.use: to buy tires for her vehicle.

loans.name: Felipa Anastasia

texts.es:
Doña Felipa Anastasia   se dedica a la  venta de agua, gaseosas y cosa de horno, iniciando sus labores desde 6 am en la preparación de los deliciosos refrescos posteriormente se traslada a diferentes  barrios de la ciudad de León de forma ambulante para su  comercialización,   la señora Felipa se dedica a este tipo de  trabajo desde hace 30  años  siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.

La Señora solicita el crédito para comprar por mayor su producto que utiliza para elaboración de su refrescos y así obtener más ganancia, para un mejor nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Felipa Anastasia works selling water, sodas and baked items.  She begins her work at 6 a.m. preparing her delicious refreshments, then later she traverses the different neighborhoods of the city of León to retail her products as a street vendor.  Señora Felipa has been doing this type of work for the last 30 years, and this business is her family's sustenance.

The Señora is requesting the loan to purchase at wholesale the products that she uses to prepare her refreshments, and in this way to generate more earnings for a higher standard of living for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, juices, bottled water and baked items.

loans.name: Rahmonkul

texts.ru: Рахмонкул проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Он имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности он механик. Сейчас он занимается скотоводством у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа бычков и телят.
texts.en:
Rahmonkul lives in the Dangara region. He is 54 years old and married. He has six children. He has specialized secondary education. His specialization is in mechanics. Currently he works with cattle breeding at his home. He has worked with this type of activity for 7 years.

Rahmonkul takes a loan for the purchase of bulls and calves.

loans.use: to purchase bulls and calves

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухаё житель района Дж. Руми. Он берет кредит для покупки досок. На сегодняшний день у него много заказов.
texts.en: Muhayo lives in the J. Rumy region. He takes a loan for the purchase of wooden boards. Currently he has a lot of orders.

loans.use: to buy wooden boards

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он занимается садоводством и посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 23 года. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Bakhtiyor lives in the Jilikul region. He is 39 years old and married. He works with gardening and planting crops. He has been engaged in this type of activity for 23 years. 

Bakhtiyor takes a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is a 61-year-old married man with 8 children from the Gubaan, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. Rogelio cultivates a rice farm. He has been cultivating rice for 13 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month in this business. 

In 2007, Rogelio joined GDMPC. He is requesting 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Desilanta

texts.en:
Desilanta is 48 years-old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has six children with one currently in school. For the past four years, Desilanta has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells sand soil used for building houses. 

To help expand her business, Desilanta has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sand to resell, and will help Desilanta to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Desilanta hopes that in the future she will be able to start selling firewood wholesale. 

Desilanta is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Desilanta who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sand to resell.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Valentina works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  Valentina is borrowing PHP 30000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Valentina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Eriza

texts.en:
Eriza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Eriza requested a PHP 22000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Eriza would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 46 years old and married with a child. For the past five years, she has been selling personal products in the Philippines. Florencia is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Florencia is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy personal products to sell to customers

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
Doña María Eugenia  se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 40 años,  prepara la comida en su casa posteriormente se traslada a uno de los mercado de la ciudad de león para  su comercialización, este trabajo lo realiza para la mantención de su familia. 

La Señora solicita el crédito para la compra por mayor el   producto que utiliza en la preparación de la comida,  con la ganancia obtenida  ha realizado muchas mejora en su vivienda, debido a eso ella se siente muy agradecida con Ceprodel por que ha logrado  un mejor nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
María Eugenia has sold food for 40 years.  She prepares the food in her house and later takes it to one of the markets in the city of León to sell.  She does this job to support her family.

She is requesting the loan for the wholesale purchase of the products she uses to prepare her food.

She has made many improvements to her home with the profits she has earned.  Because of this she is grateful to CEPRODEL because she has achieved better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic wrap, chicken, rice, oil, and an industrial stove.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира -молодая женщина 36 лет,замужем и имеет троих детей.Более 10ти лет занимается пошивом женской одежды, шьет на заказ платья и детскую одежду.Содержит семью и поддерживает бюджет семьи и своего мужа.Муж Абдуманнон тоже работает.Молодая семья зарабатывает стабильно и так как имеют востребованную профессию,решили получить кредит на приобретение второй швейной машинки.Шоира учит девочек своему мастерству и сейчас арендует цех по пошиву одежды.У неё теперь много клиентов и поэтому она хочет расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Shoira is a young woman of 36 years. She is married and has three children. She has been working with sewing women's clothing for more than 10 years. She sews dresses and children's clothing to order. She provides for her family and supports the family's budget and her husband. Her husband Abdumannon also works. 

The small family has a stable income and as Shoira has the required occupation, they decided to take a loan for the purchase of a second sewing machine. Shoira is teaching her daughter the skills and now rents a workshop for sewing clothes. She currently has many clients and therefore she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a second sewing machine

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is a 43-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

In order to earn a living, Felipe manages a charcoal retail business. He has been doing this for two years and every month he earns 5,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP in order to purchase coconut shells that will be used to make charcoal.

In 2011, Felipe joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services so that he could help improve his business and living conditions. Felipe hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells that will be used to make charcoal.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 50-year-old married woman with 2 children. She lives in Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. Priscilla has been in the business of raising hogs for 4 years and she has a net income of 6,500 PHP per month. 

Priscilla became a member of GDMPC in 2011. She is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy animal feed. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 50 years old and married with four children. For the past six years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from buying and selling firewood. Nenita works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid five previous loans from NWTF.

Nenita is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell. She aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell

loans.name: Khtouy

texts.en:
Khtouy is 31 years old. She runs a fish-selling business in a local market in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Khtouy is married and her husband supplies the fish he catches in the river to support her business. The couple helps each other in order to raise their two school-age children and provide them with a good education. 

Khtouy is requesting a 600,000 KHR loan to increase her household income by starting a new business dedicated to hog-raising. She will use her loan to purchase six piglet to raise and sell. Khtouy hopes that she will earn a good income with her new business and be able to continue to develop it.

loans.use: to purchase six piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Muhridin

texts.ru: Мухридин проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст 58 лет. Женат. Имеет 9 детей. Мухридин имеет большой участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сеет хлопок. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. За счет полученной прибыли хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en: Muhridin lives in J. Rumy. He is 58 years old, married, and has nine children. Muhridin has a large plot of land where he grows vegetables and sows cotton. He is taking out a loan to purchase mineral fertilizer. With his profit, he wants to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Его жена работает в средней школе, а Фарход занимается торговлей, чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Его родители живут с ними и всегда дают хорошие советы. На местном рынке Фарход занимается купле- продажей детской одежды и обуви. Закупает товар в соседнем рынке, он привозит красивый качественный товар. Фарход любит детей и всегда старается дарить им радость. В бизнесе помогает его заботливая жена. Фарход хотел бы получить займ для покупки детской сезонной одежды и обуви с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Фарход надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Farhod is married and is raising three children. His wife works in a high school, and Farhod works in trade in order to provide for his family. His parents live with them and always gives them good advice. Farhod buys and sells children's clothing and shoes at the local market. He buys goods at a nearby market and brings in only high quality products. Farhod loves children and is always trying to give them joy. His caring wife helps him with his business. Farhod would like to get a loan to purchase seasonal clothing and footwear for children in order to replenish his working capital. Farhod is hoping for your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 28 years old and married with two children. For the past six years, she has been running a charcoal business in the Philippines. She also earns an income from farming rice. Analyn works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid six previous loans through NWTF.
