La Señora Maria es modista, trabaja en una pieza de madera que construyo en el fondo de su hogar. Aunque su taller es un poco precario es su medio de ingresos y la forma con la que ayuda a su familia.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, comenta que siempre está con mucho trabajo y eso le ayuda y le viene muy bien.
Maria solicita el crédito para la refacción de su taller, ya que eso le permitirá trabajar mucho mejor y rendir al doble por las mejorías de su local. Y de esta forma poder aumentar sus ingresos y dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ella agradece por la ayuda, ya que es una gran oportunidad para ella.
texts.en:
Maria is a modest hard working woman. She works in a room made out of wood, in the back of her home. Even though her shop is a little bit precarious, it is the way she makes money to help her family. 

She is very hard working and has an entrepreneurial spirit. She told us that she always has a lot of work, which helps her, and that her business is doing well. She has requested a loan to make a few repairs to her work space. This will allow her to work much better, producing twice as much, thanks to the improvements to her work space. In this way she will increase her income and be able to give a better quality of life to her children. She is thankful for the help and believes that it is a great opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to make repairs to her sewing shop.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria tiene 56 años de edad, y habita junto a sus hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio de  variedad de ropa para todos los gustos preferencias. La actividad la realiza de manera ambulante en las principales zonas de la ciudad como en  mercados y plazas. Vende variedad de prendas de vestir a precios accesibles para todas las personas. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, honesta y sobre todo muy positiva. Su deseo es poder comprar variedad de prendas de vestir para surtir su negocio, con el fin de mejorar sus niveles de venta y de ingresos que le permitan continuar llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar. Esta es la razón por la cual se decidió en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL dado que no cuenta con los fondos propios para hacer la inversión en la compra de prendas de vestir como: faldas, blusas, pantalones, ropa interior, shorts, etc. Tiene plena confianza que con la ayuda de esta institución, logrará su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Ana Gloria is 56 years old and lives with her children. She makes a living selling a variety of clothing, for all types of styles. She sells by walking around in main areas of the city, like markets and town squares. She sells a variety of types of clothing at reasonable prices for everyone. She is known for being hard working, responsible, honest and above all positive. She wants to be able to buy a variety of pieces of clothing to restock her business, with the goal of increasing her sales and profits, which allow her to keep providing for her household. This is the reason that she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL, since she does not have the funds herself to be able to make an investment in her business to buy clothing like: skirts, blouses, pants, under garments, shorts, etc. She is confident that with the help of this institution, she will reach her goal of improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, pants, under garments, shorts, etc.

loans.name: San Francisco 2 Group

texts.es:
El Comité San Francisco 2 es de la ciudad de Pilar, está empezando a trabajar como grupo, se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con gran entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familiares. Ellas tienen mucha esperanza en que este programa les ayudara a poder crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas.
La Sra. Zulma se dedica a la venta de mazamorra y pescados y nos comenta que mediante el arduo trabajo que hace, puede mantener a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para el día a día.  Ella cuenta que su sueño es poder tener un negocio bien amplio donde poder ofrecer sus productos y también dar buena comodidad a sus clientes y tener más espacio para poder tener más productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pescado, con lo que tendrá más en stock y de esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda y pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank group 'San Francisco 2' is in the city of Pilar, and are beginning to work as a group. They are in their first loan cycle, with great enthusiasm and desire to get ahead, and in this way be able to help their families. The woman have a lot of hope that this program will help them be able to grow, not just economically, but also as people. 

Zulma makes a living selling 'mazamorra', a traditional sweet corn pudding, and fish. She told us that as a result of her hard work, she is able to provide for her family and give them what they need day to day. She said that her dream is to have a large business where she can offer her products and also provide her customers with a comfort place and also have more space where she can have more products. She has requested a loan to buy fish, which will increase her stock and allow her to be able to meet the demands and orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Apophia

texts.en:
Apophia is 27 years old and is single. She owns a beauty salon and has been in this business for one year. Her salon is open from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day of the week, and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Apophia has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her beauty salon business by buying more equipment, such as chairs, machines and combs to use in the business. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her beauty salon business by buying more equipment, such as chairs, machines and combs

loans.name: Sokchheng

texts.en: Sokchheng is 34 years old and married with one boy and one girl who are both still in school. To make a living, Sokchheng and her husband do rice farming and grow cassava. Her family makes less than 10 US dollar per day on average. Sokchheng has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles already and now she is requesting another loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings and to spend on land preparation. The previous loans from VisionFund have helped to feed her family better and pay her children's school fees. She hopes the requested loan will enable her to make more income so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation and to buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Kuña Katupyry” está en el primer ciclo, son mujeres con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio de sus propios esfuerzos. Son muy unidas y tratan de hacer trabajos juntas para que de esa forma puedan pasar cualquier problema que puedan tener.
Gladys es cantinera, y comenta que trabaja arduamente, se levanta todos los días desde muy tempranas horas para empezar a trabajar y vuelve muy tarde a su casa. Ella lucha por su familia, ya que quiere darles lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones no limitaciones. Su meta es poder tener una gran despensa y de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos y ser una gran microempresaria.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de jugos, gaseosas, galletitas, golosinas y demás insumos para poder surtir su cantina y de esa forma seguir generando ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group of women “Kuña Katupyry” are in their first loan cycle. They are women who have a strong desire to get ahead and help their families through their own efforts. They are a very united group and they try to work together so that they can overcome any problem that may come along. 

Gladys makes a living by running a small store. She told us that she works hard, waking up early every morning to begin working and returning to her house very late. She works hard for her family because she wants to be able to give to them what they need, without depriving them of anything. Her goal is to have a large store, and in this way improve her income and become a great small businesswoman. She has requested a loan to buy juices, sodas, cookies, snacks, and other supplies to be able to restock her store. This will allow her to continue making a profit and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy juices, sodas, cookies, snacks and other supplies.

loans.name: Hoeuy's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in the Moung Russey district, Hoeuy is a 55-year-old mother of seven children: six daughters and one son. Out of her seven children, she has one child who is still school. She earns a living through farming rainy-season rice to support her big family. She has been in this primary business for more than 10 years. 

Hoeuy has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles already while the other members in the group have been with VisionFund for three to four cycles. She successfully repaid the prior loans, which has enabled her to support her family better. With her current business, she can earn around 18,000 KHR per day. With the need to support her business, she is leading her group of five female members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pay for land preparation. She hopes this loan will help her business prosper and she hopes to keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for land preparation

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
A 35-year-old mother of two children, Yim is a rural farmer living in the area located in the Moung Russey district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. She has been farming her five-hectare farmland for more than 10 years to make a living and she supplements her income by providing plowing and water pumping service for pay. Her main challenge to the business is flooding, which has spoiled her crop.

Yim has been with VisionFund for several loan cycles and completely paid back the loans, which has helped her to support her businessl. With her current business, she manages to earn around 72,000 KHR per day to support her family. With the need to support her business, she is requesting another loan with VisionFund of 4,000,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and gasoline for her water pump. She hopes to grow healthy rice and have more crop yields to make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and gasoline for her water pump

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is 28 years old and married. He lives with his wife in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. He has no kids yet. He and his wife earn a living through farming rice and carving. He has been in this business for six years. The main challenge for him is the lack of working capital for his business. With his current business, he manages to earn a daily income of around 47,000 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Chi with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. To cope with the challenge, he is requesting a loan with VisionFund of US $750. He will use this loan to buy fertilizer and seed for his rice farming business and some materials for his carving business. He hopes to increase his family's income to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo “San Miguel” es un comité de 16 mujeres, están muy bien consolidadas. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, y todas son vecinas y amigas. Se reúnen siempre para brindarse apoyo y ayuda las unas a otras en su afán de mejorar sus vidas.
Maria forma parte de este trabajador grupo, y ella dice que se dedica a la lavandería, lava prendas de todo tipo. Gracias al buen trabajo que siempre hace ya tiene una buena clientela, cada vez en mayor crecimiento. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener una gran lavandería con muchas maquinas, y de esa forma poder también ayudar a las demás personas, dándoles puestos de trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jabones en polvo, enjuagues para ropas, suavizantes y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le acercan sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “San Miguel” group is made up of 16 women, who are very well established. These women are from the city of Villarrica, and are all neighbors and friends. They always meet to offer one another support and help, in their desire to improve their lives.

Maria is part of this hard-working group, and says that she has a laundry and washes clothing articles of every kind. Thanks to the good work she always does, she already has a good clientele that grows more and more. One of her dreams is to have a large laundry with many machines, and that way be able to also help other people, by providing them jobs.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy soap powders, clothing rinses, softeners and other supplies, enabling her to continue working and filling the orders that her customers bring to her.

loans.use: To buy soap powders, clothing rinses, softeners and other supplies.

loans.name: Kimhouy

texts.en:
Kimhouy is 32 years old and divorced. She lives with her daughter in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district where crop farming is a primary source of income for the villagers. Her dependent daughter is still in school. She has been farming rice to make a living for seven years and she supplements her income by working as a paid construction worker. With her current business, she earns a daily income of around 21,000 KHR to spend for daily expenses. 

This is Kimhouy's first loan with VisionFund. With the need to finish her house, she is requesting a loan with VisionFund of 1,500,000 KHR. She will use this loan to pay for materials to finish building her house. This loan will enable her to have a decent house to live in, especially for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy materials to finish her house building

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
A rural villager living in the Ratanak Mondul district, Chamroeun is 50 years old and married. She is a mother of three children who are dependent on her and still in school. The sources of her family's income are from their seven-hectare maize plantation, one hectare of sesame seeds and one hectare of beans. She has been in these businesses for several years. The main challenges for her businesses are insects and low yields. 

Chamroeun has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have significantly helped her make a better living.  With a good business, she is applying for another loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy crop seeds and to spend a portion of it for labor. She hopes to earn a larger income from the businesses and extend her farmland.

loans.use: To buy crop seeds and pay for labor

loans.name: Chamroeun's Group

texts.en:
Chamroeun is 33 years old and lives in a rural village in the Ratanak Mondul district, Cambodia. He has three sons who are still in school and dependent on him. To make a living, he has been farming red maize on a five-hectare farm for several years. He has another source of income from his grocery business. The main challenge for him is the lack of working capital to support his family's business in a timely manner.

Chamroeun's group consists of four members who have been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. He completely paid back his loan. The prior loan helped him make a better living. To cope with the challenges, he is leading his group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm and pay for land preparation. He hopes to increase his crop yields so he can afford to extend his farmland and repair his house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old, single and the mother of two children who are four and 15 years old. She runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for three years and gets a monthly income of 55,000 Kenya shillings. She gets additional income as a teacher.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy stock of sugar, maize flour, rice, soaps and other merchandise for her shop.

Her dream is to expand her business to be a good source of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase  more sugar, maize flour, rice, soaps and other merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Youleat's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in an area in the Dambae district, Youleat is 29 years old and married with two sons who are still dependent on her and in school. Like most of the villagers, rice farming and cassava plantation are her family's sources of income. She has been farming cassava on one hectare of farmland and rice on three hectares of  farmland for several years to support the family. The main challenge for her family's business is the drop in the price of cassava, which has affected her living conditions.

Youleat's group consists of four members who live in the same village. She has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund for two to four cycles. With her current business, she can earn around 18,000 KHR per day. Now requesting a loan with other members, Youleat is the leader and will use her portion to buy seeds, seedling and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more good quality crops and sell them for good prices to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy seeds, seedling and fertilizer

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 31-year-old single mother of two children aged 8 and 14 years. She runs a boutique and bureau that provides services such as typing and photocopying. She has been in this business for three years and gets a monthly income of 26,000 Kenyan shillings.
This will be her first loan from KADET. She plans to use the entire loan to buy another photocopy machine. With increased profits, she plans to open a second business in Limuru. 
In the future, she hopes to have a big business with steady income.

loans.use: to buy another photocopy machine.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 27 years old, single, and with no dependents. He is in the transport business commonly known as boda boda, a business he started four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES. 10,000. He wants to service his motorbike buying new spare parts for replacement and has requested his first loan of KES 20,000. 

The profit he makes from his businesses would help him educate his younger brother. His dream is to prosper in his business and live a comfortable life with his future family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for servicing his motorbike.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is thirty two years old. He is married and has three children. He has a motorcycle transport business and also sells charcoal which his wife manages for additional income. He has been in the business for three years now and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings. 

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy more charcoal for sale and also repair his motorcycle.

With the profits, he will purchase another motorbike. In the future, he plans to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle and also buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 27-year-old man. He is married to Mary. Together they have two children, aged four and six years. His wife is a hairdresser and contributes to the family income. Charles operates a motorcycle popularly known as “Bodaboda.” He has been in the business for four years, and his monthly income is 30,000 Kenya shillings.
This is his first loan from KADET, and he plans to use the loan to expand his wife’s business by buying her more hair treatment materials, such as shampoos, hair, and chemicals. With the increased income, he hopes to buy a second motorcycle.

loans.use: to boost his wife's hairdressing business by buying her more hair treatment materials, such as shampoos, hair, and chemicals

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa de treinta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro pues junto a su esposo tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura, su parcela donde siembran está ubicada en un cantón cercano a su domicilio, es muy conocida en la zona pues comercia por todos los alrededores del lugar, los clientes la prefieren porque todo es de calidad y a precios cómodos, además la amabilidad no falta en el servicio que ofrece María; es una mujer ejemplar y modelo a seguir, trabajadora, honrada, pero sobre todo humilde, quiere cumplir sus sueños y está dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para lograrlo, su primer paso para expandir el negocio es invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz y maicillo, insecticida, abonos y nuevas herramientas. María tiene buenas referencias y excelente capacidad de pago, asegura que cancelara en el plazo establecido el crédito además tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: María Teresa is 35 years old and lives with her life companion and her two children in her own home. She dedicates herself to the cultivation of corn and sorghum. She has lots of experience with this work and together with her husband they have many years of experience in agricultural work. Her parcel where she sows the seeds is located in the district close to their home. It is very well known in the area for commerce by everyone around this place. The customers prefer it because everything is of high quality and for reasonable prices. Moreover, friendliness is not lacking in the service that Maria offers, she is an exemplary woman and a model to follow, she works hard, with honor, but more than anything she is humble. She wants to accomplish her dreams and she is disposed to give everything on her part to reach them. Her first attempt to expand the business is investing in inputs, but she needs capital and for this reason she asked Integral for a loan that will permit her to buy corn and sorghum seeds, insecticide, fertilizer and new tools. Maria has good references and an excellent capacity to pay, and she assures us she will complete the loan, moreover, she has the hope that she will be able to give her family the life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy corn and sorghum seeds, insecticide and fertilizers.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 32 years old, married to Josphat, and blessed with a two-year-old child. She has a tailoring shop where she also stocks clothes material (fabric) for sale.

She started this business a year ago and has requested her first loan of KES. 20,000 to purchase clothes material, lining and zippers. 

The profit she earns will be ploughed back into her business. She dreams of buying a piece of land and building her own home as well as educating her child.

loans.use: To purchase clothes materials (fabric), lining and zippers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a thirty-one-year-old man. He is married to Pauline and they have one child aged two years. He has a motorcycle transport business. He has been in the business for three years. His wife operates a small kiosk and helps contribute to the family income. 

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy stock for his wife’s kiosk business. They plan to use the profits to expand her kiosk business to a retail shop. In the future, he wants to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy stock for his wife's kiosk business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is thirty six years old, married to Peter, who is a driver. Together they have four children aged 10, 13, 15 and 18 years. Her husband contributes to the family income. She operates a charcoal selling business. She has been in this business for three years with a monthly income of fifty-four thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy charcoal for sale.

With the increased profit, she hopes to buy a dairy cow to diversify income and provide milk for the family. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ocas al horno  que es un producto parecido a la papa y tambien vende platano al horno,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ocas y platanos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar platanos y ocas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues with her business of selling baked oca (a product that looks like a potato) and baked bananas. She sells her products as a street vendor from 8am to 6pm. Through this small business, she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand and improve her business of selling oca and bananas, so she is requesting a loan to buy these items in bulk.

The member is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy bananas and oca in bulk.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a sixty-six-year-old man, married to Josephine. They have six children aged 40, 38, 36, 34, 32, and 30 years old. He does farming business. He gets a monthly income of twenty-seven thousand Kenya shillings. 

This will be Peter’s first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy farm inputs to improve his farming. 

He plans to use the profits to rent more land to expand his income. In the future he wants to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs to improve his farming activity.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a twenty-seven-year-old man, married to Hannah. They have one child aged two and a half.  The wife is a teacher and contributes to the family income. Stephen operates a mobile phone accessories shop. He has been in business for four years and gets a monthly income of forty-five thousand Kenya shillings. 

This will be Stephen’s first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy more mobile phone accessories to increase his stock.

He plans to use the profits to open a second shop at Kwambira. In the future he hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories for expansion of the business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a thirty-eight-year-old woman, married to John. They have four children aged 18, 16, 11, and 8.  She sells cereals like beans, maize, peas, wheat and oil products at Kwambira, Kenya. Lucy has been in business for four years and gets a monthly income of twenty-nine thousand Kenya shillings. 

This will be Lucy’s first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock of assorted cereals like maize, beans, peas, wheat, etc. for sale. 

She plans to use the profits to open a store at the nearby Limuru town. In the future she hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of assorted cereals for sale.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza is 52 years old. She lives in a small village with her family, her husband Valeri and her 26-year-old son. Valeri and his son are construction workers and they work in their and nearby villages. The family runs an agricultural business. It is mainly managed by Roza. In particular they have a milking cow and 2 calves and pigs. Roza is a very hard working woman. She keeps the livestock in good condition and takes good care of them. She is busy with farming also. She has 0.5 hectare of land where she grows 300 vine trees and nuts. She sells harvested products on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 550 Lari. 

Roza requested a loan for purchasing building materials. She wants to make a wine cellar. The family will be able to produce and keep wine in the new cellar. Thus, with the loan the family will expand the family business in order to make a desired profit. Roza will sell the produced wine on the local open market. With the increased amount of profit she will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business. Due to the above, the family’s living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to make a wine cellar

loans.name: Oscar Rolando

texts.es: Oscar Rolando de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en un hogar humilde, él se dedica a la agricultura y tiene varios años de dedicarse al rubro, su especialidad es cultivar yuca y siempre obtiene las mejores cosechas, tiene muchos clientes fijos porque saben que lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente, las personas siempre quedan satisfechas; Oscar es un hombre emprendedor que siempre aprovecha las oportunidades que se le presentan, él siempre esta dispuesto a trabajar duro para que la vida le regale la felicidad, quiere sembrar un poco más en esta cosecha pero necesita de capital para invertir por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mata de yuca, fertilizante, abonos para su cuidado. Oscar Rolando tiene capacidad crediticia y muy buenas referencia de pago, además tiene la confianza que podrá con su esfuerzo darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar Rolando is 51 years old and lives in a modest home with his life companion. He engages in agriculture and has been in this line of work for several years. His specialty is cultivating cassava and is always able to generate good yields. Oscar has many established customers who know that his products are of very good quality and are sold at affordable prices. In addition, his service is excellent and always keeps people satisfied.

Oscar is an enterprising man who always takes advantage of the opportunities that are presented before him. He is always willing to work hard to achieve a happy life. Oscar wants to plant a few more crops this season, but he needs capital to invest. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy cassava plants, fertilizer, and compost required for the care of this crop. Oscar Rolando has the credit capacity and excellent payment references. In addition, he is confident that he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy cassava plants, fertilizer, and compost.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. María tiene 42 años vive acompañada desde hace más o menos 20 años, tiene dos hijas,  es de la ciudad de Santaní  pero desde que se mudó con su marido vive en la ciudad de Paraguarí.
Maria se dedica al macate  hace más de tres años, pues su esposo ya había empezado ese mismo trabajo hace ya más de diez años, trabajan juntos y ya tienen aproximadamente mil clientes. Cuentan con más de  siete zonas y para cubrirlas recibe el apoyo de toda su familia repartiéndose las zonas entre sus hijas y un sobrino.
Maria solicita el crédito para la compra de frazadas, edredones, sábanas, etc. ya que de esta manera podrá aumentar sus zonas de venta y tener un mayor ingreso, lo que le ayudará a seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 42 years old and has lived with a companion for 20 years, more or less. She has two daughters. María is from the city of Santaní, but she moved with her husband and now lives in the city of Paraguarí. Maria has been working as a "macate" (traveling merchant) for more than three years. Her husband has been in the same line of work for more than 10 years. They work together and already have around 1,000 customers in more than seven sales territories. In order to cover all of them, they get assistance from their entire family. Maria's daughters and a nephew help with making deliveries to these areas.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy blankets, bedspreads, bed sheets, and other items. She hopes to expand her sales territories and have more income, which will help her continue growing.

loans.use: to buy blankets, bedspreads, bed sheets, and other items.

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Inés tiene 53 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y emprendedora. Es madre de siete hijos, de los cuales sólo dos de ellos (los 17 y 11 años) viven con ella, los demás son mayores e independientes.
Su trabajo comienza cuando sale muy temprano hacia su chacra, se va a cultivar, regar y preparar la tierra para sus siembras de camu camu (fruto regional). También se dedica a la producción de miel de abeja. Esta actividad la realiza hace 23 años aproximadamente, aprendió  esta labor desde muy joven, ya que lo heredó de sus padres. Ahora ella está enseñando a sus dos menores hijos, quienes después de volver del colegio se van a ayudarla y así aprenden del negocio familiar. Le gusta que porque puede compartirlo con sus hijos y tiene buenas ventas, ya que los productos que le dan sus tierras son muy buenos. Ella envía su producción a la ciudad de Lima donde su otro hijo se encarga de venderlos. Espera poder mantenerse así y más adelante poder empezar con otro tipo de producto.

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas y así no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece, ya que todos son muy responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, 3000 soles, comprará más semillas y pagará a algunos trabajadores que le ayuden a sembrar pimiento, e iniciar una nueva producción.
texts.en:
Inés is 53 years old and a cheerful, friendly, and enterprising woman. She is the mother of seven children, but only two of them (ages 17 and 11) live with her. The rest are grown and independent.

Her work begins when she leaves early to get to her field. Her tasks involve cultivating, irrigating, and preparing the land so that she can plant her "camu camu" crop (a regional fruit). Inés also produces honey. She has been in business for approximately 23 years. Inés learned this trade as a young woman since she was taught by her parents. She now teaches her two young children after they return from school. By helping her, they are able to learn the family business. Inés enjoys her work because she is able to spend time with her children and also generate good sales. The products that are yielded by the land are very good. She ships her products to the city of Lima, where another son is in charge of selling them. Inés hopes to continue earning a living so that she can move forward and begin planting another type of crop.

This will be her fifth loan with MFP. Inés is pleased to know that she will have a loan to help her complete her goals. She promises to be punctual with her payments because she does not want to be on bad terms with her group since everyone is very responsible. The loan amount of 3,000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy seeds and to pay a few workers to help with planting bell peppers so that she can start a new crop.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to hire workers.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
Divino Niño es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Caacupé, gracias a las ganas de salir adelante que tienen 10 mujeres de esa ciudad. Las integrantes vieron en el programa de la fundación paraguaya una gran ayuda, que les permitirá crecer en todos los sentidos.
 Reina es la presidenta del grupo, y nos cuenta que siempre se esfuerza por ayudar a sus compañeras en todo lo que puede, para que así todas estén siempre a gusto y cómodas en el grupo. Reina tiene una librería bien surtida donde vende todo tipo de útiles escolares, además de eso nos comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que luego, gracias a su trabajo poco a poco ha logrado ir creciendo.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de útiles, como ser cuadernos, lápices, marcadores, libros y demás, con lo que podrá tener variedad y bien surtido su negocio, ya que tiene muy buena venta.
texts.en:
"Divino Niño" (Divine Child) is a group that formed in the city of Caacupé as a result of the drive to succeed demonstrated by 10 women who are from that city. The members view the program with Fundación Paraguaya as a great help because it will allow them to grow in every way.

Reina is the group president. She says that she strives to help her fellow members in every way she can by always making them feel comfortable and at ease. Reina has a well-stocked bookstore where she sells all types of school supplies. She says that she started out with a small business, but later it grew gradually as a result of her work. Reina is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as notebooks, pencils, markers, books, and other items so that she will have variety and adequate stock in her business. She already has very good sales.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, markers, books, and other items.

loans.name: Ermo

texts.es:
El Sr. Ermo es casado desde hace varios años.  Tiene 5 hijos mayores casados e independiente de él y su esposa. Ermo trabaja en compra-venta de artículos reciclados, se inició con un pequeño capital que venía ahorrando de otros trabajos que  realizaba y en la actualidad ya tiene su propio negocio.
Gracias a su trabajo tiene una casa cómoda y con todas las necesidades del hogar. Él ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de los materiales reciclados, como ser plásticos, bronces, cartones y demás, los cuales revende y de allí tiene sus ganancias. El ya tuvo otros créditos con la fundación y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones
texts.en:
Ermo has been married for several years and is the father of five adult children who are married and live independently from him and his wife.  Ermo works buying and selling recycled materials, a business he began with a small amount of capital he was able to save from other jobs, and now works for himself.  Thanks to his work, he has a comfortable home and all the household necessities.  He has proven himself to be very responsible and honest in his commitments.

On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to buy recycled materials, such as plastics, bronzes, cardboard and other materials, which he will resell for a profit.  He has had previous loans from the foundation and has an excellent credit record.

loans.use: To buy recycled materials such as plastics, bronzes, cardboard and others.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El Señor German tiene 34 años, vive en de la Ciudad de Carapeguá, está en pareja con la Señora Graciela con quien tienen 1 hija llamada Milagros de 5 años, por quienes ellos luchan diariamente, pues es su razón de ser.
El Señor German tiene como profesión la  albañilería hace aproximadamente 10 años y trabaja en forma particular en la ciudad de Carapeguá y alrededores, nos comentó que empezó como ayudante albañil y que luego hace 5 años empezó a trabajar en forma independiente. Hoy día ya tiene su clientela formada y siempre consigue trabajo gracias a la buena calidad de sus labores. Es una persona muy trabajadora y esforzada que lucha día a día por lograr sus objetivos y dar así una mejor calidad de vida a sus seres queridos.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas para su trabajo ser, baldes, cucharas, metros y demás, lo cual le facilitará mucho lo que hace.
texts.en:
German, 34, lives in the city of Carapeguá with his wife, Graciela, and their five-year-old daughter, Milagros, who is their reason for living and working hard every day.

German has been working as a bricklayer for approximately ten years, and has his own business working in and around the city of Carapeguá.  He began as a bricklayer assistant, then five years later started working independently.  He has a fixed customer base and continuous orders to fill because of the quality work he does.  He is a very hard worker who strives daily to meet his objectives and give his loved ones a better quality of life.

He is requesting a loan to buy tools for his work such as buckets, measuring cups, rulers, etc., which will make his work easier.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El  Sr.  Mario tiene 57 años de edad, cuenta con una despensa desde el año 2006 en la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Comenta el que tiene una gran clientela ya que atiende muy bien a sus clientes y sumado a ello siempre tiene muy buenos precios.
Con este trabajo logro mejorar su vivienda y darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos que hoy en día ya son independientes. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma ser un gran comerciante.
El necesita de este crédito para la compra de azúcar, panificados, lácteos, carnes y demás tipos de productos. El agradece la oportunidad que recibe a Kiva y de fundación paraguaya, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Mario, 57, has been running a store in the city of San Lorenzo since 2006.  He says he has a good number of customers because he serves them well and always offers good prices.

Through his work he has been able to renovate his house and give his children the education they needed to become independent, as they now are.  His goal is to continue working to become a grand merchant.

He is requesting a loan to buy sugar, bakery goods, dairy products, meat and other types of products.  He is grateful for this opportunity Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya are giving him, because it will be of much assistance.

loans.use: To buy sugar, bakery goods, dairy products, meat and other products.

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es:
El Sr. Fidencio vive acompañado con su pareja la Sra. Teresa. Es cliente de la fundación desde el año 2003. Se dedica a la Compra y Venta de carbón y de garrafas de gas.
En sus comienzos realizaba las ventas de Carbón en una carretilla hecha de madera, la cual aun posee. Con el tiempo fue adquiriendo otros elementos de trabajo, es así que pudo adquirir un Moto Carro abierto para poder realizar las ventas y llevar sus productos a los clientes, el inconveniente con el que tropezaba eran los días de lluvias. Actualmente adquirió otro Moto Carro pero esta vez con carrocería cerrada con lo cual ahora en todo tiempo puede transportar sus productos, con y sin lluvia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de carbón con lo cual podrá surtirse y de esa forma poder cumplir siempre con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fidencio lives with his wife, Teresa, and has been a member of the Fundación since 2003.  He buys and sells coal and gas pouches for a living.

He started his business with a wooden wheelbarrow, which he still owns.  But over time he bought other work tools, eventually acquiring an open motorcar for his sales activity and product delivery to customers.  The problem was that rainy days posed inconveniences.  He now has bought another motorcar, covered this time, so he can deliver products, come rain or shine.

He is requesting a loan to buy coal to fill customer orders.

loans.use: To buy coal to sell.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y ha adicionado la venta de lencerías a su negocio. Gracias al crédito anterior de Kiva pudo mejorar su trabajo y de esa forma pudo crecer un poco mas.
Hoy vuelve a solicitar un crédito, para la compra de lencería, ya que tiene muchos pedidos y le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos. Su meta es poder tener un gran negocio donde poder ofrecer mucha variedad de prendas y así seguir creciendo.
Ella agradece por la nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Mariela sells all kinds of clothing, and has added lingerie to her product line.  Thanks to the previous loan from Kiva, she has improved her work and expanded a bit more.

Now she is requesting a loan to buy lingerie, since she has many orders and wants to fill them.  Her goal is to have a larger business so she can offer a variety of clothing and continue growing.

She is grateful for this new opportunity, which will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: To buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Ndungu

texts.en:
Ndungu is a fifty-three-year-old man, married to Serah. They have two children aged 19 and 21.  He does horticultural farming in Kimana, Kenya. He has been in business for two years and gets a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings. 

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD. Ndungu will use the entire loan to buy more land for farming.  He plans to use the profits to increase farming land.  In future he hopes to own a big piece of land for horticulture.

loans.use: to buy more land for farming.

loans.name: Antonieta Yanet

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de golosinas,caramelos y galletas,la socia tambien hace servicio de llamadas y tambien siguen teniendo un taller donde confeccionan muebles,ella junto con su familia trabajan en este negocio,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las golosinas,caramelos y galletas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar golisinas,galletas y caramelos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member continues to work selling snacks, candy and cookies. She also offers a telephone calling service and she still has a workshop where she and her family work together to make furniture. Through these small businesses, our member is able to provide for her children. Her dream is to have the premises from where she can sell her snacks, candy and cookies. Our member is requesting this loan to buy snacks, cookies and candy.  

She is happy about the loan and she is committed to respecting the repayments.

loans.use: to buy snacks, cookies and candy.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La Srta. Graciela tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera tiene una hija de 13 años, vive con sus padres y con dos sobrinos. La Srta. Graciela es muy emprendedora, desde muy temprana edad  empezó a trabajar fuera del país donde estuvo más de diez años, luego regreso a su ciudad natal para montar una ropería. Alquila un local en el mercado hace dos años.
Comenta que en principio le costó un poco por la competencia que existe, pero con mucho sacrificio creó su clientela inclusive saliendo a vender en forma ambulante, luego consiguió vender al por mayor y le va muy bien. Recuerda sus días de trabajo en el exterior y valora muchísimo estar nuevamente en su país. Su sueño es trabajar a gran escala y es por eso que lucha.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones, remeras, vestidos, champion, zapatos, otros, con los que podrá surtirse y ofrecer buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Graciela is 34 years old. She is single and has a 13 year old daughter. She lives with her parents and with two nephews. Graciela is very enterprising: from a very young age she began to work abroad where she stayed for more than ten years. She then returned to her home city to set up a clothes shop. She has been renting a unit in the market for the last two years. 

She says that when she started out, it was difficult because of the competition which existed, but with a great deal of sacrifice she established her clientele, including by going out to sell in the street. She then managed to sell wholesale and is very successful. She remembers her days working abroad and she is very happy to be back in her country. Her dream is to work on a large scale and this is what she is fighting for. 

She is requesting the loan to buy trousers, T-shirts, dresses, sneakers, shoes and other items which she will stock in order to offer a wide variety to her clients.

loans.use: to buy trousers, T-shirts, dresses, sneakers, shoes and other items.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 58 years old. She lives in a small village with her family: her husband, Vladimer, and two children aged 20 and 22, both who are students. Vladimer works in a local company. The family runs an agricultural business, they have two milking cows and two calves. Mariam keeps the livestock in good condition and takes good care of them. She is also busy with farming. She has 0.5 hectare of land where she grows 1,500 vine trees and nuts. She sells the harvested product in the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Lari. 

Mariam requested a loan for purchasing calves. She wants to raise and sell them after a few months with a price mark up. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to make the desired profit. Mariam will sell grown calves and get the profit. She will use it for improving her family members' living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Maguli

texts.en:
Maguli is 68 years old; she lives in a small village with her family: husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (17 and 20 years old). The family runs an agricultural business, in particular 3 milking cows, 3 calves and 2 sheep. Maguli is a very hard-working woman; she keeps the livestock in good conditions and takes good care of them. She is busy with farming also: she has 0.7 hectare of land where she grows 700 vine trees. She sells the harvested produce at the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari. 

Maguli requested a loan to purchase calves. After the calves are grown, she will have more milk and will be able to produce more dairy foods and sell them in nearby villages. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to make the desired profit. With the increased amount of profit, she will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business as well as improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is a 62-year-old widow blessed with four children aged 40, 26, 18 and 11 respectively. She practices crop farming, which she started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a third loan of KES 15,000 to purchase fertilizer. The anticipated profit will help her expand her farming by purchasing a dairy cow.

Her hope is to have a diversified kind of farming one day.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Mirla

texts.es:
Mirla tiene 20 años, es una joven mujer soltera que trabaja mucho, pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres, quienes le inculcaron siempre a servir a su familia.
Su trabajo comienza desde las 4 de la madrugada, a esa hora se levanta y comienza con los preparativos para realizar su trabajo; limpia y desinfecta todos sus utensilios con los que realizará su rutina de producción de pan. Junto a la ayuda de sus padres realiza su trabajo, ya que son sus grandes maestros y de quienes aprendió hasta los mínimos detalles de su actividad. Lleva realizando su trabajo por más de 5 años, desde muy niña le llamo la atención. Le está yendo bien, tiene muchos clientes, a quienes nunca falla y tienen su pedido de pan a la hora y lugar indicado. Espera seguir trabajando y seguir creciendo poco a poco para mejorar su negocio.

Este es su primer crédito con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos y crecimiento programado. Está muy decidida a cumplir con sus pagos, pues le agrada mucho saber que pertenecerá al grupo que son muy puntuales y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes, insumos y materiales para su negocio, desea renovarlos y aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Mirla, age 20, is a single young woman who works hard because she wants to provide a better quality of life for her parents, who instilled in her to always serve one's family.

Her day begins at 4am, which is the hour when she wakes up and starts the preparations for her work. She cleans and disinfects all of the utensils that will be used in her production routine for making bread. Mirla has help from her parents when performing her work since they are great teachers. She learned from them the most minute details about the business. Mirla has been in this line of work for more than five years and recalls being interested as a young girl. She is doing well and has many customers since she never fails to complete and deliver an order at the correct time and place. Mirla hopes to continue working and growing little by little in order to improve her business.

This is her first loan with the MFP organization. She expects to continue with her goals and her projected growth. Mirla is very determined to complete her payments and appreciates knowing that her group is punctual and responsible. The amount of 1,000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy ingredients, supplies, and materials for her business. She wants to update and increase her production.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is 58 years old; she lives in a small village with her family: her two daughters and grandson. She runs an agricultural business; in particular she is busy with farming. She has 0.5 hectare of land where she grows 200 vine trees and nuts. She sells the harvested products at the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Lari. 

Lili requested a loan to purchase calves. She will be able to produce more dairy products and sell them in nearby villages. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to make the desired profit. With the increased amount of profit, she will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business. Due to the above mentioned, the family’s living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 47 years of age, married to Aggrey and blessed with three children aged 22, 19 and 16 respectively. She has been selling eggs for the past six months and this business has been earning her a monthly income of KES 4,000. She is applying for a first loan of KES 15,000 to purchase more crates of eggs. The profit she earns will enable her pay school fees for her children. She hopes to see her children reach higher levels of learning.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs for sales.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 32-year-old single mother of four children in the business of baking snacks. She started her own bakery a year ago and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000.

She has requested a first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase a mixer, five bales of baking flour, margarine, sugar and eggs. The profit she earns will be ploughed back into her business. 

She dreams of buying a piece of land and building her own home as well as educating her children.

loans.use: To purchase a mixer, five bales of baking flour, margarine, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is 42 years old; she lives in a small village with her family: her husband, two sons (21 and 23 years old), daughter-in-law and mother-in-law. The family runs an agricultural business; in particular, they have 3 milking cows and a calf. Inga is a very hard-working woman; she keeps the livestock in good conditions and takes good care of them. She is busy with farming also: she has 1 hectare of land where she grows 1,000 vine trees and nuts. She sells the harvested products at the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Lari. 

Inga requested a loan to purchase agricultural machinery and tools. She will be able to cultivate more land at a decreased cost and get more profit. Also, Inga will be able to rent the purchased machinery out to neighbor farmers and get additional income. With the increased profit, she will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to make the desired profit. Due to the above mentioned, their living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural machinery and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, sodas and sweets for sale.

loans.name: Wincate

texts.en:
Wincate is a 43-year-old mixed-crop farmer; she is married to Peter, a primary school teacher. They are blessed with two children aged 18 and 13 respectively. She has been a poultry farmer for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff. She will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase biscuits, groundnuts, sodas and juices for sale.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel tiene 41 años, es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable. Viven en su casa propia junto a su pareja y sus dos hijos de 10 y 7 años, a quienes les brindan educación y desea darles una mejor calidad de vida.
Su trabajo consiste en la siembra de pimienta y yuca. Él se encarga de sembrar y cosechar en su chacra, en la cual está a diario para ver sus sembríos, brindarles cuidado y regarlos, ya que para que tenga una buena cosecha tiene que darle mucho cuidado. Lleva trabajando en este negocio por aproximadamente 20 años, ya que empezó desde muy joven. Trabaja solo y en algunas ocasiones contrata a otras personas para que le ayuden en la siembra y cosecha para tener todos sus productos y pedidos a tiempo. Le gusta todo lo que hace, con esto creció y con esto está educando a su hijo, además le gusta ver cómo es que sus frutos crecen y se hacen grandes, los cuales vende en el mercado (la yuca) y envía a la ciudad de Lima (el pimiento).

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos. Le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará granos para sembrar y una cabeza de ganado, ya que quiere empezar a criar también.
texts.en:
Fidel, age 41, is a hardworking and responsible gentleman. He lives in his own home with his partner and their two children (ages 10 and 7) for whom they want to provide an education and a better quality of life.

Fidel's work consists of growing bell peppers and cassava. He is in charge of the planting and harvesting in his field, where he looks after his crops each day. In order to obtain a good harvest, Fidel must provide his crops with much care and regular watering. He has been in this business for approximately 20 years since he started at a very young age. Fidel works alone, but occasionally he will hire other people to help with the planting and harvesting so that he can have all of his products available for completing his orders on time. He enjoys what he does and his job has enabled him to grow and provide an education for his son. Fidel enjoys seeing his crops grow and get bigger. The cassava is sold at the market and the bell peppers are shipped to the city of Lima.

This is his sixth loan with MFP. Fidel is pleased to know that he will have financial support. He feels confident about advancing in his business. Once again, just as he did with his previous loans, he promises to complete his payments. Fidel appreciates being part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. The loan amount of 1,000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy grains for planting and a head of cattle because he wants to start raising animals.

loans.use: to buy grains for planting and a head of cattle.

loans.name: Mirson

texts.es:
Mirson tiene 44 años, es soltero y padre de un hijo que ya es mayor de edad y tiene su propia familia. Vive solo en su casa propia, donde algunas veces llegan sus hermanas y su hijo a visitarlo o a pasar un fin de semana.

Se dedica a la siembra de productos regionales, también tiene algunas cabezas de ganado, los cuales se dedica a comprar y vender. Estas actividades las realiza en su chacra ubicada a pocos kilómetros de su casa. Lleva en este trabajo ya 15 años, trabaja solo, pues su hijo es independiente y tiene otras tierras. En algunas ocasiones contrata peones para ayudarlo, sólo en época de siembra y cosecha. Le gusta mucho su labor, ya que está siempre al aire libre y dispone de su tiempo como a él mejor le parece, además dice que no hay nada mejor que ser independiente. Espera poder mantener su negocio, ya que de eso vive y espera seguir haciéndolo por varios años más.

Este es su préstamo número 15 con la institución MFP. Le muy bien en su grupo, es socio fundador y es un buen pagador de sus cuotas. Agradece mucho la oportunidad que le dieron para crecer con su trabajo y espera poder seguir haciéndolo por mucho más tiempo.
Con el monto solicitado, 2500 soles, comprará productos regionales de otras chacras para venderlas al por mayor en la ciudad. También invertirá en la compra de granos y abono para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Mirson is 44 years old, single, and the father of a son who is already grown and has his own family. He lives alone in his own house, but sometimes his sisters and his son will come visit or spend the weekend.

Mirson grows regional products and also has a few head of cattle since he buys and sells them. His activities take place in a field located a few kilometers from his house. Mirson has been in this line of work for 15 years. He works alone now that his son is independent and has land of his own. Occasionally he will hire workers to help him, but only during the planting and harvesting seasons. Mirson greatly enjoys his work because he is always outdoors and gets to make use of his time as he sees fit. He also says that there is nothing better than being independent. Mirson expects to maintain his business since he plans to continue making a living for several more years.

This is his 15th loan with the MFP organization. He gets along well with his group since he is a founding member and has an excellent payment history. Mirson is grateful for having the opportunity to grow in his work and hopes to continue doing so for a long time. The amount of 2,500 PEN that he requested will be used to buy regional products from other fields that he can sell in bulk in the city. He will also invest in the purchase of grains and compost for planting crops.

loans.use: to purchase grains, compost, and regional products to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 29-year-old lady from Kisumu County and is married to Daniel, with whom she has 4 children aged between 2-10 years. 

Josephine operates a maize cereal selling business in Kisumu and has been doing this for the last two years, making a monthly income of 4,000 KES. She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy more stock of maize cereals for resale.  She will use her profits to pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy a stock of maize cereals

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 40-year-old lady from Kisumu and is widowed with five children aged between 6-17 years.

Josephine operates a fish selling business in Kisumu, a business she has been doing for the last 10 years, and makes a monthly income of 3,000 KES. She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy more stock of fish for resale.  Her profits will be used to pay school fees for her kids.

Her dream is to be successful in business.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 23-year-old lady from Kisumu and is married to Kennedy, with whom she has one child aged 5 years.

Elizabeth operates a secondhand clothing business, a business she has been doing for the last 3 years, and makes a monthly income of 4,000 KES. She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to add more stock of clothing. Her profits will be used to add more stock of clothing and providing for the needs of her family.

Her dream is to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothing for resale

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 23 years old, single and with no dependants. He is in the bicycle transport business commonly known as boda-boda, a business he started four years ago, and earns a monthly income is 20,000 KES. 

He wants to venture into another line of business and has requested his first loan of 30,000 KES to purchase stock for this business which is to operate a grocery shop. He expects to make profits which he will use to purchase more stock for the grocery business as well as for expansion of the business. 

His dream is to own successful businesses as well as to purchase a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to puchase fruits, green grams (mung beans), beans and rice for sale in his new line of business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy televisions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a specialized printer and magnet-making machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase uniforms and signs for his vehicle.

loans.name: Justo German

texts.es: El Sr. Justo tiene 49 años no es casado pero tiene su pareja con quien convive desde hace varios años, tiene 5 hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura tiene su parcela en la localidad de la Angostura,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Justo va a usar este préstamo para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y el preparado de la tierra,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo en el momento, el Sr. Justo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar  su  calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar  su  producción, una vez cosechado sus productos los vende en el mercado de la localidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Justo, age 49, is not married.  However, he has lived with his life partner for several years.  He has five children.  He devotes himself to agriculture, and his plot is in Angostura. 

This loan is his first loan cycle within the institution.  Justo will use this loan to buy seeds to plant potatoes and to prepare the land.  His reason for requesting this loan is his lack of cash at the present time.

The challenge that Justo faces in his business is to improve his quality of life.  He will use the profits to improve his production.  Once harvested, he sells his products at the market directly from the producer to the consumer.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant potatoes and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Mujeres Patzuneras Group

texts.en:
Martina belongs to Mujeres Patzuneras Trust Bank, along with 15 more women. She is 42 years old, married to a mason named Lorenzo, and lives in Patzun, Chimaltenango, which is located in Guatemala’s central highlands. Lorenzo and Martina have five girls, three of whom are in school. The girls’ ages range from nine months old to 22 years old. 

Martina is by nature a weaver and embroiderer, techniques that she learned from her mother when she was a child, as is custom in most indigenous communities in Guatemala. 

Martina joined Friendship Bridge six months ago for her first loan, which she used to start a new business – making and selling tortillas. She rents a small store to sell her tortillas. The store is located in the center of Patzun, which is about 10 minutes from her home. Martina’s business is going well and she has applied for a new loan, which she will use to purchase maize in large quantities for her tortilla-making business and thread in bulk for her embroidery.

Martina runs her tortilla business from 7:30 a.m. to 9 p.m. seven days a week. She also weaves and embroiders when she has time. Martina is very excited about this new loan, because it will give her the opportunity to make an income and support her daughters’ education. One of her daughters, Norma, is in the ninth grade and wants to study accounting. Martina never attended school, but she understands the importance of education for the family’s and community’s development, so she encourages her girls to stay in school. 

Martina is determined to see her new business grow so that she can employ at least two women. She also wants to start selling tomatoes and some vegetables along with tortillas (in the same spot).

loans.use: To purchase maize in large quantities.

loans.name: Sambok's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in the Ratanak Mondul district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Sambok is a 29-year-old mother of one son. 

She is a farmer who plants on 3.5 hectares of farmland as the family's primary source of income, and she sometimes works for others for pay to gain extra income. She has been in this business for several years. The main challenge for her family's business is the lack of working capital to support her business. 

Sambok has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and she successfully paid back the loan with VisionFund. The loan has helped her family afford sufficient food and increase the family's income. 

To cope with her challenges, she is now leading her group of four members to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to user her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for plowing. This loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a living better. She also hopes to extend her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis de 64  años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos, una de ellas es mayor, profesional ya independiente, y los demás son adolescentes quienes apoyan a su padre trabajando de cerca en las obras que realiza.
Don Luis hace más de 25 años se inicio como ayudante de obras realizando pinturas, aprendió la profesión y se independizo, actualmente además de ser contratista de obras cuenta con un local de ventas de pintura y artículos de ferretería. Necesita capital para aumentar su stock de pinturas, clavos brochas y otros, y es por ello que solicita el crédito.
Agradece a fundación paraguaya por el apoyo ofrecido a través de este crédito ya que le será de mucha ayuda a el y a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 64 years old. He is married and he has three children. One child is older and now she is a independent professional. The other two children are adolescents who help their father by working on his projects.
More than 25 years ago, Luis started as a construction assistant doing painting. He learned the profession and became independent. Now he is a contractor and he has a paint and hardware shop. He needs capital in order to increase his stock of paint, nails, brushes and other items. This is the reason why he is requesting a loan. 
He is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the support offered through the loan. It will give lots of help to Luis and his family.

loans.use: purchase paint, nails, brushes and other items.

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia, es una cliente que está sacando crédito por cuarta vez, en el momento de la evaluación del crédito la Sra. demostró una actitud buena,   La Sra. Silvia vive en la zona Cotahuma, de la ciudad de La Paz Bolivia, ella en la actualidad vive con sus dos pequeños niños, el esposo trabaja  en una empresa,  La Sra. Silvia saco este crédito para la compra de una conservadora y el saldo para la compra de mercadería abarrotes para su tienda y surtirla, su negocio es grande y está en plena avenida, con el tiempo ella  quiere llegar a tener su propia casa, con esmero, voluntad y trabajo.
texts.en: Silvia, a client in her fourth loan cycle, showed a great attitude at the loan evaluation. Silvia lives in the Cotahuma area of the city of La Paz, Bolivia. She currently lives with her two small children; her husband works for a company. Silvia is taking this loan to buy a cooler and groceries to stock her store. Her business is large and in a good location. She hopes, in time, to own a house through careful planning, desire, and hard work.

loans.use: to buy a large cooler and wholesale groceries.

loans.name: Delcy

texts.es: Delcy  de 47 años de edad vive al sur occidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y su hijo de 17 años de edad, con el que sueña ver convertido en un ciudadano muy exitoso. Ella tiene una microempresa desde hace 6 años, que se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios para ellos, también ofrece servicio de llamadas telefónicas. Sus productos son de un inmejorable consumo pero la tecnología avanza y cada día es un desafío responder a su clientela con accesorios y equipos modernos. Sus compras la realiza 2 o 3 veces por semana y su rotación de inventarios es de 10 días. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  porque requiere invertir en accesorios que roten más rápidamente, con su crédito comprará accesorios y celulares, para responder la demanda insatisfecha en el sector de su mercado y esto acompañado de su experiencia, es lo que hace que su credikiva tenga un alto potencial de éxito.
texts.en:
Delcy, age 47, lives to the southwest of the city with her husband and her 17 year old son.  She dreams of seeing her son become a very successful citizen.

She has had a small business for six years.  She sells cell phone and accessories for cell phones.  She also offers telephone call service.  Her products are excellent sellers.  However, the technology advances, and it is a challenge every day to respond to her clientele with modern accessories and equipment.  She makes her purchases two or three times a week, and her inventory turnover is ten days.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She needs the loan to buy accessories that turn over more rapidly.  She will use the loan to buy accessories and cell phones to respond to the unsatisfied demand in this sector of her market.  Making these purchases, coupled with her experience, is what makes her Kiva loan have a high potential for success.

loans.use: to buy accessories and cell phones in order to respond to the demand that has not been met.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustin es un una persona de negocios, que junto a su esposa hace la compra-venta de lavadoras. Llevan 15 años casados, los hijos ya estan casados.
Al señor Agustin se le presento la gran oportunidad de crecer su negocio con la compra de lavadoras a mayoreo con un menor precio, no cuenta con el capital suficiente asi que se acerca a nosostros para aprovechar esta oportunidad y ofrecer mas variedad de lavadoras.
texts.en: Agustin, a businessman, and his wife sell washing machines. They have been married for 15 years, and their children are married. Agustin was offered the chance to grow his business by purchasing washing machines at a discount. He did not have the capital, so he approached us so that he could take advantage of this opportunity and offer a wider selection of machines.

loans.use: to buy washing machines.

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Mach is 25 and married. She has one daughter who is dependent on her and is too young to attend school. She lives with her family in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Cambodia. Like other villagers, she is a rice farmer who has been farming rice as her single source of family's income for several years. 

Mach's group consists of four members who live in the same village. She has been with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles, while the other members have been with VisionFund for one to four loan cycles. After the loans with VisionFund, she is confident that she will gradually increase her standard of living. With her current business, she now can earn around 11,000 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. 

Now the group is requesting a new loan with VisionFund. Mach, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she strongly hopes to grow more rice and increase her family's income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokan's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of five children, Sokan is 53 years old and she still has four children dependent on her. Only a few of them are still in school. 

She earns a living through farming rice on her one-hectare farmland, and she has been in this business for ten years. She supplements her income by raising pigs in the back yard. The main challenge for her as a rural farmer is the lack of working capital to buy fertilizer. 

Sokan has been with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund for five to seven years. The past loans from VisionFund have significantly helped her make a better living. She currently earns around 24,600 KHR per day from her business. 

Sokan is leading this group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and feed for her pigs. She hopes to increase her family's income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Sorphorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorphorn is 32 years old and married with one daughter who is now too young to attend school. She lives with her family in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland for several years, and she supplements her income by running a grocery store in front of her house. The main challenge for her family's business is flooding during raining season and the lack to water to grow her rice. 

Sorphorn's group consists of three members and she has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. Having completely paid back the loans with VisionFund, the loans have helped her make the living better. With her current business, she can earn up to 24,000 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and grocery items for her business. She hopes this loan will enable her business to prosper and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Kakvey's Group

texts.en:
A mother of four children living in a village of the Thmor Koul district, Kakvey is 37 years old and married. She still has a few children in school. The source for her family's income is mainly from rice farming. She has been in this business for more than ten years. Her main challenge for her business is the lack of working capital to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

Kakvey has been with Kiva's partner VisionFund for four loan cycles already and she completely paid back the previous loans, which enabled her to keep her children in school.
