She is leading her group of four members who have been with VisionFund for four to six cycles to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more income so as to set aside some money to afford to repair her house and also extend her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea, 24, is a rural villager in the area of the Moung Russey district. She is a mother of two dependent sons who are still under school age. 

She is a rice farmer while her husband is a paid car worker. She has been in this business for several years to make a living. 

Kunthea's group consists of two female members who have been with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund, for three loan cycles. They both successfully paid back the previous loans. After the loans, she is confident that she will make a better living. 

With good business goals, she and her group member, Nop, are applying for another loan of 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is 40 years old and married with six children, two of whom are still dependent and now still in school. She lives with her family in a rural area of the Mongkol Borey district, Cambodia. To make a living, Sokhom farms rice on her one-hectare farmland as her primary source of income for 10 years. She supplements her income by running a small grocery store just to earn enough to support daily expenses. Her husband is a paid worker in the village. The main challenge for her family's business is the flood which destroyed her crop and decreased her crop yields. 

Sokhom's group consists of three members who all are female. Sokhom has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles while the other two members have been with VisionFund for one to five years. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her to afford sufficient food for her family. Now requesting a loan with other members, Sokhom who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to lease another one-hectare farmland. She hopes to make more rice with good quality and sell it for a good price so as to improve her living condition and set aside some money to lease more farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Ngeb's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in the Mongkol Borey district, Ngeb is 43 years old and married. She has six children, three of whom are dependent and still in school. She is a rice farmer who owns one hectare of farmland and she also makes baskets for sale to gain extra income while her husband is a paid worker in the village. Ngeb has been in this business for almost ten years. The main challenge for her is the lack of working capital to support her business.

This is the seventh loan cycle for Ngeb's group, consisting of two members. They both successfully paid back the loans with VisionFund. The past loans from VisionFund have helped Ngeb improve her living and have sufficient food to eat. Currently, she can earn up to 22,000 KHR per day from her current business. Now requesting a loan, Ngeb who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy bamboos for secondary business. She hopes this enable her to make more income so as to set aside some money to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in the Thmor Koul district where crop farming is a common business to earn a living, Mom is 40 and married. She has three daughters dependent on her and they are still in school. Like other villagers, her primary source of income is rice farming. She has been in this business for ten years and she has managed to earn a daily income of around 20,000 KHR to spend for daily expenses. The main challenge for her family's business is the lack of rain water to supply her farm. 

Mom's group consists of two members and she is just with VisionFund this loan cycle while another member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now requesting a loan, Mom who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthfully and increase crop yield so as to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Age 30 years old, Ra is married and has three children, one daughter and two sons, who are dependent on him. He and his wife live and make a living farming rice in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district. He supplements the family's income by working as a paid worker. He has been in this business for almost 10 years. The main challenge for his family's business is the lack of rain water for his rice field. 

This is the second loan for Ra with VisionFund while the other members are just with VisionFund this loan cycle. Ra's group consists of three members who lives in the same village. The first loan from VisionFund has helped his family improve their living condition. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR each, Ra who is the leader, will use this loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase crop yield and the family's income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is a 29-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is now in school while the other is under school age. She lives with the family in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. Rice farming is the main business activity for Mom to support daily living and she has been in this business for almost 10 years while her husband is a paid worker in the village. 

Mom has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and she completely paid back the loans with VisionFund. After the successful loan repayment with VisionFund, she feel empowered and is confident to earn for a better living. With her current business, she can earn around 14,000 KHR per day for daily expenses and she is able to save almost 9,000 KHR each day for the future needs. With a good business, she and her group member, who is just with VisionFund, are applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn a larger income for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Soly's Group

texts.en:
A dweller in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Soly is 43 years old and has three children, one daughter and two sons. To make a living, she has been raising chickens on the site as a primary business for 3 years. The main challenge for her family's business is the illness of her chickens.

Soly's group consists of two members and they both have been with VisionFund for one loan cycle already. After successful loan repayment with VisionFund, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Soly is going to use her portion to spend for fencing to block her chickens. She hopes this loan will enable her to fill in the free space of her business site and hopes to sell chickens for a good price.

loans.use: To purchase fencing for her business

loans.name: Heroina

texts.es: Heroína  de 41 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo, con su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en las edades de 4 a 23 años. Allí mismo tiene una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres y en general artículos de la canasta familiar, que usualmente compran las familias de su alrededor, para satisfacer las necesidades de alimentación diaria. Su negocio lo inició hace 13 años, en su propia casa, con el fin de apoyar la gestión de su esposo en pro del bienestar de su hogar, quien labora como trabajador independiente de la plomería. Durante el tiempo de desarrollo de su negocio, a Heroína le ha tocado enfrentar desafíos importantes y en su vida familiar, por eso durante un periodo regresó a su pueblo y cerró el negocio y hasta  hace 5 años  está en el municipio de Malambo, lugar donde retornó y nuevamente  emprendió su tienda. En la familia todos son coherentes con las tareas asociadas al negocio, por eso cuando tiene que ofrecer servicios en casas de familia, para generar otros ingresos adicionales, deja esta actividad a cargo de sus hijos, quienes la asumen con la mayor disposición. Heroína es una mujer trabajadora y siempre ha desarrollado actividades productivas, antes también estaba dedicada a vender mercancías varias, chicha, bolis etc. Ella espera organizar cada vez mas su negocio, por eso acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará un enfriador de oportunidad a un precio atractivo y víveres en mayor volumen que el acostumbrado, para lograr buenos descuentos y continuar siendo competitiva, aprovechando las oportunidades del mercado para sostenerse y ser cada día mas exitosa.
texts.en:
Heroína, 41, lives in the town of Malambo with her husband and 5 children, who range in age from 4 to 23. In her store, she sells food, supplies, and general household items to the neighboring families for their daily consumption. She started the business in her house 13 years ago in order to help her husband, who works as an independent plumber, support their household. While she was building her business, Heroína had to confront serious family issues and had to close the business and return to her town. For the past 5 years, she has been in Malambo, where she opened her store again. 

Everyone in the family knows the tasks associated with the business. Therefore, when she must go to other homes to offer her services and generate more income, she can leave her children in charge of the store because they are qualified. Heroína is a hardworking person who is always involved in productive activities. Previously, she sold a variety of goods such as corn sweet drinks and pens. 

To further establish her business, she is seeking a Kiva loan and coming to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for her first financing . With this loan, she will buy a freezer at a good price and purchase supplies in higher volume than she normally does so that she can buy at substantial discounts and continue being competitive by taking advantage of market opportunities to support herself and make each day more successful.

loans.use: to buy a freezer at a good price and supplies in large volume.

loans.name: Liz Paola

texts.es: Liz es socia de Bancomunal Virgen Del Carmen, tiene 23 años de edad, es madre de un menor hijo, se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos los cuales vende por mayor a las ferreterías. Le gusta mucho asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal ya que gracias a las capacitaciones que allí recibe aprendió a no sobre endeudarse, a ser puntual y sobre todo responsable. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en: Liz is a member of the Virgen Del Carmen communal bank. She is 23 years old. She is a mother of a young son. She makes bricks that she sells wholesale to hardware stores. She likes to attend the communal bank meetings very much. Thanks to the training that she has received, she has learned how to not go into debt, how to be punctual and more than anything, how to be responsible. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of supplies for the production of bricks.

loans.use: purchase supplies for the production of bricks.

loans.name: Daría Iris

texts.es: Daría es socia del Bancomunal Ternura, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y tiene su consultorio de rehabilitación Física ya que ella es profesional especialista en rehabilitación, el local donde funciona su consultorio es alquilado, pero ella está ahorrando mucho para que pueda tenerlo en su casa y otra sucursal. En FINCA Perú ella aprendió la disciplina y el compañerismo. Su meta es tener su propia clínica de rehabilitación. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de gel, aceites esenciales para las terapias físicas, material para las terapias.
texts.en: Daría is a member of the Ternura communal bank. She is 52 years old and the mother of 7 children. She makes a living by selling cosmetics and has a physical rehabilitation practice, since she is a professional rehabilitation specialist. The place that serves as her practice is rented, but she is saving a lot to be able to have it in her house and another office. From FINCA Peru, she learned the discipline of companionship. Her goal is to have her own rehabilitation clinic. The loan she is requesting will be used to invest in buying gel, essential oils for physical therapy, and materials for therapy.

loans.use: to buy gel, essential oils for physical therapy, and materials for therapy.

loans.name: Martun

texts.en:
Martun is 53 years old and has three children: two daughters and a son. His son Michael and elder daughter Anna are students of Yerevan State University’s Ijevan branch. Anna is in her fifth year of education in the psychology department. Michael is a second-year student in the history department.   

Martun and his family live in Ijevan city. Martun works as a manager at one of Ijevan's social organizations. His wife and younger daughter are both music teachers: his wife works at a kindergarten and his daughter works at a music school. Martun's elder daughter Anna dreams of being a teacher like her mother and sister. His son has been interested in history since he was little and therefore chose history studies. Martun is asking for a 230,000 Armenian dram loan to pay Anna's and Michael's tuition fees for second semester at university.

loans.use: to pay his children's tuition fees for second semester at university

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata es socia del Bancomunal Ternura, tiene 63 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos, se dedica a la venta de cereales y abarrotes en el mercado. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y poder construir su casa ya que actualmente vive en un cuarto alquilado y la construcción es rústica, ella dice que lo va a lograr porque tiene fuerza de mujer trabajadora. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, harina, leche y cereales como trigo, habas, maíz  para su negocio.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the Ternura Community Bank. She is 63 years old and has seven children. She earns her living selling cereal grains and groceries in the market. Her dream is to buy a piece of land and build a house on it, but at the moment she lives in a simple rented room.

Fortunata says that she will be fine as she has a hardworking woman’s strength. The loan will be used to buy supplies for her store: rice, sugar, oil, pasta, flour, milk, and cereal grains such as wheat, beans, and corn.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, pasta, flour, milk, and cereal grains such as wheat, beans, and corn.

loans.name: María Asunción

texts.es: María es socia del Banco Comunal Ternura, tiene 49 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años, es dueña de un restaurante donde solo vende comida por las noches porque es la hora cuando hay clientes. Su meta es tener una tienda donde pueda vender abarrotes y bebidas, ella esta muy segura de que lo lograra ya que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideos, papa, por sacos para su restaurante.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Ternura Community Bank. She is 49 years old and has three children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years.

María owns a restaurant where she sells food in the evenings, the time when there are lots of customers. Her goal is to have a store where she can sell groceries and drinks. She is very confident that this will do well as she has the support of her husband and children. The loan will be used to buy sugar, rice, pasta, and potatoes for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, pasta, and potatoes for her restaurant.

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor, aged 41, is a rural villager living in an area located in the Mongkol Borey district of Cambodia. She has two children: one daughter and one son. She earns a living through farming rice as her single source of income and she has been in this business for several years. The main challenge for her family's business is low crop yields. 

This is the first loan for Sor with VisionFund, while the other two members, Loeum and Ith, have been with VisionFund for two previous loan cycles. Now leading her group of three members to apply for a loan, Sor will use her portion for land preparation and to buy fertilizer. She hopes to increase her crop's yield and quality so she can sell it for a good price. She would like to set aside some money for building on her savings so she can afford a hand tractor for the family's business.

loans.use: to prepare her land and buy fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: La señora lilia esta solicitando un prestamo para poner una losa de concreto en la parte de enfrente de la casa, ella es una persona muy trabajadora. Actualmente tiene tres micronegocios uno de ellos es el de venta de ropa nueva y seminueva otro es la venta de  comida ya sean tacos mañaneros o menudos los fines de semana, tambien vende lo que son los productos del avón ya que ella comenta que quiere sentirce util y buscar por todos los medio el generar ingresos para no ser una carga para sus hijas y tambien para poder consentir a sus nietas quienes me dice son su vida.
texts.en: Sra. Lilia is requesting a loan in order to install a concrete slab in front of her house.  She is an extremely hardworking person.  Lilia currently has three small businesses:  one selling new and semi-new clothing, another selling food (breakfast tacos and tripe soup) on the weekends, and a third selling Avon products.  She says that she feels useful and that by having all of these methods for generating income, she does not feel like a burden on her daughters.  Lidia also gets to spoil her granddaughters since she says they are an important part of her life.

loans.use: to build a concrete slab.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay the workers who work in the rice fields

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a 42-year-old lady from Kisumu who is married to Jared. They have five children but also support one orphan child.

Roseline has been operating a grocery stall for the last 13 years and makes a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd., which she will use to add more stock of fruits and vegetables. She will use any profits to support her family.

Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: to add more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is a 32-year-old lady from Kisumu who is married to Tobias. They have four children aged 2-10 years.

Roselyne has been operating a grocery stall selling various kinds of vegetables and fruits for the last seven years and makes a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd., which she will use to buy vegetables and eggs for resale. Her profits will be used to provide household items.

Her dream is to be successful in business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and eggs

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en:
Leang is 54-year-old mother of seven children living in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district, Three of them are dependent children who help support the  family's business. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice on five-hectare farmland. She has been in this business for more than ten years. The main challenge for her family's business is the lack of working capital to support the business.

Leang's group consists of two female members who have been with VisionFund for six loan cycles and they both successfully paid back the loans with VisionFund. The past loans have helped Leang extend her farmland and she is confident of earning a living after loan repayment. Now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Leang who is the leader will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land preparation. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and earn a larger income so as to set aside some money for her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 56 años, es una mujer alegre, responsable y sobre todo muy trabajadora. Está casada y vive junto a su esposo una su casa propia, donde crían y educan a su nieto.
Su trabajo consiste en la siembra de fréjol, maíz, camu camu y otros productos. Tiene sus cultivos de camu camu en la chacra cerca de su casa, pero también en otro distrito cerca de la ciudad. Ella realiza su trabajo de forma directa y diaria, junto a su esposo y su nieto. En época de siembra se encarga de buscar a algunos peones para que le ayuden a preparar la tierra y en época de cosecha también. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene mucho tiempo para poder hacer otras actividades, además de que al trabajar a lado de su esposo y su nieto le da la confianza de una buena producción.

Este es su crédito número 17 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por su parte, se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 2000 soles, comprará más granos, además de pagar a algunas personas para que le ayuden a cosechar.
texts.en:
Luz is 56 years old and a cheerful, responsible, and above all, an extremely hardworking woman. She is married and lives with her husband in their own home. There they are able to raise and teach their grandson.

Her work consists of growing beans, corn, "camu camu" (a small fruit native to the Amazon), and other products. Luz has "camu camu" crops in a field near her home, but also in a plot located in another district near the city. She performs her work day after day with her husband and grandson. During the planting season, she supervises a few workers who help prepare the land and also provide assistance at harvest time. What she likes about her job is having plenty of time to devote to other activities. By working with her husband and grandson, Luz is confident that her crops will result in good production.

This is her 17th loan with MFP. Luz is very pleased to know that she will have financial support and is confident that she will advance in her business. Just like she did with her previous loans, Luz promises to submit her payments on time. She is also happy to belong to her Communal Bank since all of the members are responsible and supportive. The loan amount of 2,000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more seeds and to pay a few workers to help with the harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to hire workers to help with harvesting.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of three children, Chan is 41 years old now and she lives with her family in an area located in the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. Some of her children are still in school. Her primary source of income is rice farming which she has been doing for almost twenty years. She also runs a grocery store selling seasonings, eggs, soap etc as a secondary source of income for her family. The main challenge for her family's business is the lack of rain water for her rice field. 

Chan's group consists of two members. She is in her fifth cycle  while her group member is with Kiva's partner, VisionFund just this loan cycle. The past loans from VisionFund have helped Chan make a better living. Currently, she can earn around 14,400KHR per day to  spend for her daily expenses. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Chan, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy grocery items for her store. She hopes to increase her family's income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and grocery items for her store

loans.name: Roeun's Group

texts.en:
Roeun, aged 46 years old, is married with five children. She lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. Out of her five children, she still has two children to take care of and they both are still in school. Her primary source of income is from three-hectare rice farming. Roeun has been in this business for several years. A rural farmer, her main challenge for the  family's business is the lack of working capital. 

Roeun has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles while her member is just with VisionFund this loan cycle. She completely paid back the previous loans which has helped her make a better living and to afford to spend for her children's studies. Currently, she can earn 24,300KHR to spend for daily expenses. Now Roeun is requesting a loan with VisinoFund, Roeun who is the leader will use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is a hardworking business lady. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. She hopes to grow her business and employ people. She has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair treatments, hair braids and shampoo.

loans.use: to buy hair treatments, hair braids and shampoo.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es:
Norberto de 47 años de edad, vive en una colonia de la zona periférica de la ciudad de San Pedro Sula junto a su pareja y sus 3 hijos.
El señor Norberto se gana la vida vendiendo todo tipo de frutas y verduras entre ellas, tomate, chile, repollo, melones, mangos, bananos, cebolla etc. lleva 8 años de realizar esta actividad con la cual obtiene los ingresos necesarios para el hogar. Sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante, estacionándose con su carreta en las aceras del mercado local todos los días.
Por primera vez con ODEF está solicitando un préstamo de 3,000.00 Lempiras con los cuales va surtir de productos frescos de frutas de la temporada y verduras de todo tipo para ofrecer a los clientes e incrementar las ventas. Todo su esfuerzo es para tener siempre mejores ingresos para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Norberto is 47 years old and lives in the subdivision of Zona Periférica in the city of San Pedro Sula with his partner and their three children.

Sr. Norberto earns his living by selling all types of fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, chili peppers, cabbage, melons, mangoes, bananas, onions, and other items. He has been this business for eight years and is able to generate necessary income for his household. His sales are conducted as a street merchant by parking his cart every day within close proximity of the local market.

Norberto is working with ODEF for the first time and is requesting a loan of 3,000 HNL so that he can restock with fresh products, such as seasonal fruits and all types of vegetables, to offer to his customers and increase sales. All of his efforts are geared toward improving his income so that he can provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to restock his business with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Julia Elena

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer muy trabajadora, es madre de un pequeño de 5 años de edad al cual cría sola ya que hace algunos años el padre de su pequeño la abandono y la dejo sola; Julia es padre y madre para su hijo, ella trabaja muy duro para hacer que su hijo tenga lo que necesite sobre todo mucho amor. Julia a raíz de lo que estaba pasando trabajo realizando muchas actividades, principalmente trabajaba en la pequeña bodega que tienen sus padres en el mercado de su ciudad, poco a poco con su gran esfuerzo fue ahorrando y tuvo la idea de tener su negocio de play station y lo logro; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable, atenta y sobre todo porque Dios siempre guía sus pasos a pesar de las adversidades.

Julia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar 2 computadoras para poder ofrecer el servicio de internet en su negocio, de esta manera ella podrá ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes y también mejorar sus ingresos; lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a  su hijo y que tenga una vida feliz”.
texts.en:
Julia is a very hard-working woman and mother of a little one, 5 years old, she is raising by herself, since the father abandoned her some years ago, leaving her alone. Julia is both father and mother to her son. She works very hard to provide him with necessities, above all providing much love.

Julia is involved in many activities, principally working in her parents' small general store in the city market. Little by little, with great effort she has been saving, and had the idea of creating a play station business, which she has now achieved. Julia spends around 10 hours a day attending to up to 15 customers a day. Julia believes the business is going well, because she is very friendly and attentive and, above all, God always guides her steps, in spite of adversities. 

Julia is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they provide, she will be able to offer better service to her customers and, also, improve her income. That will permit her to continue the struggle to make her grandest dream a reality: to offer her son professional training so that he can have a happy life.

loans.use: to buy computers for her play station business.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in the Ratanak Mondul district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Kunthea is  25 years old and married. She has been planting red maize as her family's primary business for several years. The main challenge for her family's business is the lack of working capital. 

Kunthea is the second cycled client and she successfully paid back the loan with VisionFund while her group member is just with VisionFund this loan cycle. The past loan from VisionFund has helped Kunthea afford sufficient food for her family to eat. With her current business, she can earn around 9,000 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses and is able to save around 5,000 KHR each day. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn a larger income and to set aside some savings to afford to extend her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is married and the mother of one child. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling groceries. She supplements her income by selling cooked food. Maureen has grown her business since joining Faulu Kenya because of the training she has received on business management skills. In the future, she hopes to continue growing her business and hire employees to help her with her work. She has requested a loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy tomatoes, onions and bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions and bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en:
Saroeun, aged 49, is a mother of six children who lives in a rural village of the Mongkol Borey district, Cambodia. She has four dependent children. One of her children is still in school and others are working in Thailand to help support her big family. Saroeun has been farming rice for almost twenty years to support her family and sometimes she works as a paid worker. 

Saroeun is requesting her first loan with VisionFund. She is a member of a group loan, and the other members, Sarath and Nuon, have been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. Saroeun is the group leader of this VisionFund loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and seed for her farm and also will pay for plowing. Saroeun hopes to increase her rice crop to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farm

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai, aged 29, is a mother of three children. She lives in a rural village of the Mongkol Borey district. All three of her children are still in school. 

Mai is a rice farmer while her husband is a taxi car driver. She has been in this business for almost 10 years. The main challenge for her family's businesses is insufficient water for her farmland and lots of competitors for the taxi business. With her family's businesses, she can earn around 54,000 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Mai's group with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend for plowing and car maintenance. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family's income so as to set aside some money to afford to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland .

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 32 years old, married and has two children. She sells groundnuts to earn a living. She has been engaged in the business for 11 years and has employed one person. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to renovate her business premises.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha es socia del Bancomunal Tulipanes, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, su mayor prioridad son sus hijos, se dedica a la compra y venta de repuestos de Autos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 4 años, en todo este tiempo que es socia aprendió a ahorrar, a ser responsable y puntual, le encantan las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal y las reuniones porque aparte  de aprender le permite relajarse al encontrarse con sus amistades. Ella logró conseguir las expectativas que tenía de su negocio porque implemento su local y  construyo su casa además de brindarles calidad de educación a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos de autos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Communal Bank "Tulipanes" (Tulips). She is 41 years old and the mother of four children who are her greatest priority. Martha buys and sells auto parts. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years. During this entire time as a member, Martha has learned how to save and how to be responsible and punctual. She enjoys the training classes offered by her Communal Bank and the meetings because she is able to learn and still have a good time relaxing with her friends. Martha was able to follow through with the goals she had for her business because her store is established in her home. In addition, she was able to provide a quality education for her children.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of auto parts for her business.

loans.use: to buy auto parts.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is 33 years old and married with two children. She is a rural villager who lives in the Mongkol Borey district. For the past ten years, Sok has been a rice farmer and her husband is a paid worker in the village. Her group loan consists of four members who live in the same village. Sok has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and the other members of her group have been with VisionFund for between one to five cycles. Sok's first loan from VisionFund helped her to support her family and extend her farmland, and she is currently able to earn around 20,000 KHR.

Sok is leading her group and requesting another loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Sok hopes to increase and improve her rice crop and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Ngilesi

texts.en:
Ngilesi is married and has four children. For the past four years, she has run a grocery business to earn a living and she also runs a retail shop to generate more income. Ngilesi has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has learned business management skills.  

Ngilesi is requesting a 15,000 KES loan to buy potatoes and tomatoes. In the future, she hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and tomatoes

loans.name: Neuece

texts.en:
Neuece used her loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add stock of clothes. She made good sales, and hence, more profits from her business. She used the additional income from her business to expand her business. She hopes to open another outlet of her business in the future.  

She has requested 30,000 Kenya shillings to add stock of clothes.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is married and the mother of two children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling clothing. She has grown her business since joining Faulu Kenya because of the training she has received on business management skills. In the future, Agnes hopes to grow her business and employ people. She has requested a loan for 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is the married father of six children, four of whom are in school. He owns a furniture workshop which he started off three years ago from his savings. In this business, Stanley makes chairs, cupboards, beds, doors, etc. The business is located in the rural area of Mariakani and he believes with enough stock of furniture, he can make good sales.

Stanley was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 73,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase workshop stock, e.g., timber, nails, latches, etc. The challenges facing the business are the high cost of timber and transportation costs. Stanley sees this solved by purchasing items in bulk. His future ambition is to purchase planes/smoothing machines and become a renowned supplier of furniture material in the area.

loans.use: to purchase workshop stock, e.g., timber, nails, latches, etc.

loans.name: Tondo

texts.en: Tondo lives in the coastal town of Mariakani, Kenya, where she has earned a living for the last three years by running a grocery stall. She is married and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in school. She was introduced to Milango by her friends, and is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy more groceries to sell to her customers, including tomatoes, kale, cabbage and avocados. The main challenge she faces is poor weather, especially when there is not much rain and the amount of produce she can sell is reduced. She will use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay her son’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Chuot's Group

texts.en:
Chuot is 33 years old and a mother with three children. She lives in a rural village in the Mongkol Borei district of Cambodia, and her children are still in school. For the past six years, Chuot has been a rice farmer who cultivates a one-hectare farm. She supplements her income by raising six pigs. Chuot's main business challenge is the lack of working capital to support her business. She has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles and has fully repaid her previous loans which she has used to increase her business. 

Chuot is the leader of her loan group which is requesting a loan of 300,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR. Her loan group partner has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. Chuot will use her portion of the loan to buy feed for her pigs. She hopes that her loan will enable her to feed her pigs so they will be fat and healthy and able to be sold for a good price.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a 52-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She sells "ukay-ukay" (slightly used clothing) in her community, including men's and women's shirts, jeans and blouses. Diosdada works hard to support her husband and provide for her family's needs. 

Diosdada is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell such as shirts, skirts, and blouses. She hopes that her income will increase and that her family's standard of living will improve.

loans.use: to buy clothing, such as shirts, skirts, and blouses, to sell

loans.name: Srun's Group

texts.en:
Srun and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for 10 years to support their family. They live with their children in a rural area located in Dambae district, where growing cassava to sell is a common business. Srun's biggest challenge is when the price of cassava drops, leaving her family with insufficient funds to continue the business and pay for her children's education.

Srun obtained her first loan from VisionFund in 2011. Having completely repaid her previous obligation to VisionFund, Srun is now applying for her second loan, while her other two group members are applying for their second and third loans, respectively. As group leader, Srun will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seedlings and to prepare her land for her crops. She hopes the loan wiill help her to grow good-quality crops so she can sell them at a high price and as a result have enough money to support her family and pay her girls' school fees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings and prepare her land for her crops

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy lives in the coastal town of Likoni, Kenya, where he has earned a living for the last five years by running a food café. He is married and the father of two children. He started his business with his personal savings and has made it profitable, in part because he is in a good location with many residents who are attracted by low-cost housing. The main challenges he faces are fluctuating prices and the high cost of materials. He would like to increase the capacity of his cafe because that would maximize his income. He was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan for 31,450 Kenyan shillings to buy plastic and arm chairs. His ambition is to turn his café into a world class hotel in the near future, and he believes that the additional income made possible by this loan will help him improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy plastic and arm chairs.

loans.name: Tuzamurane/ Rubyiro Group

texts.fr:
Zabulon  fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane/Rbyr. Le nom du groupe signifie «développement mutuel ». Il a 33 ans, il est marie avec 3 enfants de 10 ans à 3 ans, dont 2 scolarise. Son niveau d’éducation est de 7 ans de primaire.il un 1 enfant en charge autre que ses enfants.


Zabulon est agriculteur du riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture du riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait agrandir ces  champs du riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille
texts.en: Zabulon is a member of the Tuzamurane/Rbyiro group. The group's name means "mutual development".  Zabulon is 33 years old and married with three children ages 3 to 10, two of whom attend school.  Zabulon finished seven years of primary school.  He has one dependent child in addition to his children.  He is a rice farmer.  This is his second round of loans with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay for the labor of his rice farm.  To grow his business, he plans to ask for other funds.  In the coming years, he would like to expand his rice fields to satisfy the markets.  With the profits, he plans to pay his children's school fees and his family's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay for the labor of rice farming.

loans.name: Horacio

texts.es: Horacio un hombre corpulento y bien parecido, que vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, lugar ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe, afirma de manera jocosa, como la cultura de los habitantes de esta tierra, que un embutido preparado por él,  tiene “efectos  que activan la imaginación ” y  la gente no puede dejar de sonreír al escucharlo. Su negocio tiene mucha acogida en el mercado, en el cual es reconocido por su carácter agradable y muy Caribe. Horacio tiene su propio negocio, con su esposa con la cual trabaja, vendiendo morcillas, (embutido preparado con arroz, sangre de cerdo, y verdura) arepas, empanadas, cervezas, gaseosas, y víveres en general; en su negocio a esta pareja, le ha ido muy bien, pero tienen el sueño de ampliarlo, hasta convertirlo en una importante distribuidora de embutidos y carnes frías de la región, para que en el futuro sus dos hijos, que hoy están en las edades de 18 y 21 años de edad, tengan una gran empresa. Su mayor desafío, ante el crecimiento de su mercado,  es el insuficiente capital de trabajo, para lograr invertir en mayor volumen y ampliar su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos para la preparación de morcilla, fritos, así como refrescos y bebidas que enfriará y venderá a  sus clientes, aprovechando el calor y la sed que producen una tierra de playa, brisa y mar, lo que acompañado de su experiencia de negocios,  hace que esta inversión tenga mucho éxito.
texts.en: Horacio is a big handsome man who lives in the town of Puerto Colombia, a place located on the shores of the Caribbean sea.  He states in a humorous way, as is the custom of the residents of this area, that a sausage prepared by him has "effects that activate the imagination," and the people can't help but smile at that.  His business is very well-accepted in the market, because it is known for being a welcoming place with a Caribbean flavor.  Horacio has his own business, and he works with his wife selling morcillas (sausages prepared with rice, pig's blood and vegetables), arepas (stuffed grilled corncakes), empanadas, beer, soft drinks and general groceries.  For this couple, the business has done very well.  But they have a dream of expanding it, and even converting it into an important sausage and cold cut distributor in the region, so that in the future their two children, now 18 and 21, can have a big company.  His main challenge, given the expected growth in his market, is that his working capital is insufficient to allow him to buy in greater volume and expand his customer base.  This is the reason that he came to apply for his Kiva loan, which will be his first loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  With this loan, he will buy supplies to make sausages and fried foods.  He will also buy soft drinks and other beverages that he will chill and sell to his customers, taking advantage of the heat and the thirst it produces in this land of beaches, breezes and sea which, in combination with his business experience, will make this investment very successful.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make sausages and fried food, and to buy beverages to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en: Sidi lives in the town of Likoni, Kenya, where she has worked as a farmer for the last eight years. She started with a quarter acre of land, but has expanded her farm to an acre and a half. She plants cassavas, bananas, maize and other items for sale and for her personal use. Sidi joined Milango to access credit for her business and is applying for a loan for 5,450 Kenyan shillings to cultivate her land and buy seeds. This will increase her income and allow her to become self reliant. Her ambition is to buy cows and goats from the additional income she earns. She believes she will do well in her business despite the climatic changes facing her business.

loans.use: to cultivate her land and buy seeds.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 56 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Nestor, quien es agricultor, con quien tiene dos hijos ya mayores. Julia inició su actividad de despensera hace más de 20 años y gracias a la constancia y el empeño que sostuvieron con su esposo, lograron formar a sus dos hijos, quienes ya son mayores de edad, cada uno con sus profesiones.
Gracias a la buena atención y a la amabilidad de esta señora, y sumado a la ayuda de su familia es que su negocio cada vez va mejor. La Meta de Julia es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma sentirse siempre útil y salir adelante.
Julia necesita del crédito para comprar más arroz, fideos, panificados para poder surtir su negocio, ya que son los productos que más vende. Ella y su esposo agradecen por la ayuda que están recibiendo, ya que es una buena oportunidad de progreso.
texts.en:
Julia is 56 years old and married to Sr. Nestor, who is a farmer. They have two children who are already grown. Julia started her food pantry more than 20 years ago. Thanks to their perseverance and commitment, Julia and her husband were able to nurture their two children. They are now adults and each one has a job.

As a result of Julia's good service and friendliness, along with help from her family, her business is improving with each moment. Her goals are to continue working, feel useful, and move forward. Julia needs a loan to buy rice, noodles, and baked goods to restock her business since these are the products that sell the most. She and her husband are grateful for the help they have received and view it as a good opportunity to make progress.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and baked goods.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia es socia del Bancomunal Ternura, tiene 55 años, tiene 6 hijos, se dedica a la venta de quesos por mayor ya sea en el mercado, en las tiendas y a sus vecinos también, ella viaja a los distritos cercanos de la ciudad, para que pueda traer los quesos de las diferentes ferias y luego venderlos. Ella dice que los préstamos que le brinda FINCA Perú la han ayudado bastante tanto en su negocio y en lo personal, porque ahora vive mejor y está feliz al lado de sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de quesos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Communal Bank "Ternura" (Tenderness). She is 55 years old and has six children. Claudia sells cheeses wholesale at the market, but also to stores and her neighbors. She travels to the districts near the city and brings back cheeses from different fairs that she will sell at a later time. Claudia says that the loans provided by FINCA Peru have been a great help to her business and in her personal life. She and her children now live better and are happy.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of cheeses for her business.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en:
Sareth is 30 years old and married. She has one son. She is a rural farmer who lives in the area of the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of her family's income, and she has been farming on three-hectare farmland for five years. The main challenge for her family's business is the lack of working capital to buy fertilizer for her rice field. 

This is the second loan for Sareth's group, which consists of three members who live in the same village. The first loan from VisionFund has helped Sareth extend her farmland to increase crop production. To cope with the current challenge, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to further increase crop production and sell her rice to make a good income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida, a resident of Mariakani, Kenya, is a married mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She owns a cereal-milling machine which has been operating for four years. This machine grinds/mills most cereals such as maize, millet, cassava, etc. which the residents then use to make meals. It is a great source of income since most such farm produce undergoes this a process, especially that which comes from the subsistence farmers.

Saida is requesting a loan of KES 41,900 to buy spare parts and make repairs to her machine. Her ambition is to install three machines in various areas and also to start selling cereals. Saida expects to achieve these goals through the income earned from this business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and make repairs to her milling machine.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima variado y sobre todo su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de maíz, algodón, entre otros; desde pequeña aprendió lo que es ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente, por ello a ella siempre le gusta trabajar. Es madre de 2 hijas las cuales tiene 25 y 21 años, a quienes ha sacado adelante sola ya que el padre de sus hijas la abandono y tuvo que ser padre y madre para ellas, con ella solo vive la menor de sus hijas quien la apoya mucho con los quehaceres del hogar. Albina trabaja como recepcionista de un hospedaje, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas y nos comenta que cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo honrada.

Albina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar unos mejoramientos en su vivienda como tarrajeo de su cocina y arreglo de lavadero, ya que constantemente su vivienda su inunda por este motivo , de esta manera podrá  mejorar su casa ya que por las continuas inundaciones algunos de sus artefactos se han malogrado y esta mejora permitirá poder tener una mejor calidad de vida, para así seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio de abarrotes en su casa”.
texts.en:
Albina is a very hard-working woman. She lives in the city of Imperial, which is known for having a variable climate, and above all for its agriculture, especially the cultivation of corn and cotton, among other crops. When Albina was very young, she learned what it is to earn her daily bread through the sweat of her brow, and for this reason she has always enjoyed working. She is the mother of two daughters who are 25 and 21, and she has raised them alone, since the father of her daughters abandoned her, and she had to be both mother and father to them. Only her younger daughter lives with her, who helps her greatly with the household chores. Albina works as a receptionist in a small hotel; she works about 8 hours, and she comments that she thinks her work is going well for her, because she is a very responsible person, and above all honest. 

Albina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have provided to her, she will be able to carry out some improvements to her home, such as plastering the walls of her kitchen and repairing the sink, since her home is constantly being flooded due to this problem. In this way she will be able to improve her home, since due to the continual floods some of her possessions have been damaged, and this improvement will allow her to have a better quality of life. In this way she will be able to keep working hard to make her greatest dream a reality: "Having a grocery store in her home."

loans.use: to improve her home (plastering the walls of her kitchen and repairing the sink).

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a dressmaker from Dauis, Bohol. She is 45 years old and is a married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 25 years old while the youngest is nine. Her husband is a fisherman.

Aside from making dresses, Isabel also makes uniforms and provides general alterations to clothing. She hopes to build her own shop in the future. She has requested this loan to purchase dressmaking materials such as threads, clothes, and needles. Isabel hopes for her business' profitability to increase. She hopes to have sufficient money for her children's education since enrollment is near.

loans.use: To purchase dressmaking materials such as threads, clothes, and needles

loans.name: Jesús Emiro

texts.es: Jesús de 20 años,  vive en el municipio de Malambo, de su madre tiene la mas profunda admiración, porque lo enseñó con su ejemplo y su apoyo económico, a ser un negociante; él empezó su actividad como comerciante hace mas de un año, cuando ella le dio productos cosméticos, dulces y su negocio de refrescos, para que se ayudara en el pago de su universidad y le sirvieran para solucionar sus propios gastos de joven.  Jesús empezó vendiendo a sus compañeros de estudio de la universidad y posteriormente como consiguió trabajar en una empresa los fines de semana, adicionó otros clientes entre sus compañeros de trabajo. Su meta es culminar su carrera universitaria y por eso se prepara para lograrlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  productos cosméticos y perfumería,  que llegaron con descuentos importantes, en  los catálogos  con los cuales promociona su mercancía y aprovechará estas promociones, teniendo en cuenta los pedidos que hacen sus clientes,  en está época en la cual se incrementan sus ventas, por razones de festividades familiares, religiosas etc.  Esta Inversión proyecta ser exitosa por que está apoyada en la demanda del mercado y porque ha ganado la credibilidad de sus clientes, en lo referente a los precios de las mercancías que vende.
texts.en: Jesús, 20, lives in the municipality of Malambo.  He has profound admiration for his mother, because she taught him by example, and gave him financial support so that he could become a merchant.  He started his retail business more than a year ago, when she gave him some cosmetics products, sweets and soft drinks to sell to help him pay for his university and create a way for him to cover his own expenses.  Jesús started out selling to his fellow university students, and later, when he found employment in a company on the weekends, he added other customers among his work colleagues.  His goal is to finish his university degree, and he is prepared to do this.  At this time, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan that he has taken from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that he will use to buy cosmetic products and perfumes.  He can get significant discounts from the catalogs that are promoting their merchandise, and so he will take advantage of these promotions, taking into account the orders he has from his customers.  In this season of the year, sales increase because of family parties, religious festivities, etc.  This investment is projected to be successful because it is supported by the market demand, and because he has gained the credibility of his customers with regard to the prices of the merchandise that he sells.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Dufashanye Cyamura Group

texts.fr:
Prosper  fait partie du groupe Dufatanye/Cymr. Le nom du groupe signifie «Travail ensemble ». Il a 45ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 12 ans à 1 ans, dont 3 scolarise. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de primaire.

Prosper est agriculteur du riz. C’est son Première cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture du riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait agrandir ces  champs du riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille
texts.en:
Prosper is a member of the Dufatanye/Cymr group. The group’s name means “Working together.” He is 45 years old and married, with five children ranging from 12 to one years of age. Three of the children are in school. His educational level is three years of primary school.
Prosper is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan in order to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay the cost of labor for his rice farm.

In order to grow his business, he plans to continue taking out loans. In the years to come, he would like to enlarge his rice fields so as to meet market demand. He plans to use his profits to pay the costs of  education  for his children and healthcare for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay the cost of labor for his rice farm.

loans.name: Duhurizehamwe/cyamura Group

texts.fr:
Jean Baptiste  fait partie du groupe Duhurizehamwe/Cymr. Le nom du groupe signifie «met en comme ». Il a 35ans, il est marie avec 1 enfants de à 4 ans, dont 1 scolarise. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Baptiste est agriculteur du riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture du riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait agrandir ces  champs du riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille
texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is a member of the Duhurizehamwe/Cymr group. The name of the group means "we're joining forces". He is 35 years old, married, and has one 4-year-old child. His child goes to school. He has six years of primary school education.

Jean Baptiste is a rice grower. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay the labor costs for his rice production.

In order to expand his business of growing rice, he plans to seek more loans in the future. In the coming years, he would like to enlarge his rice fields in order to meet the demand of the markets. With the profits, he plans to pay for the education of his child and cover his family's medical costs.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay the labor costs for the workers working in the rice fields

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos 2 dos quais já nos seus lares e o mais novo ainda frequenta a Escola. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu sobrinho enviando alguns géneros alimentícios. 	
Trabalha na empresa de produção e venda de banana como empacotador, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, porta, cimento, areia, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir e mobilar a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal tenciona pagar devidamente este empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O maior desafio é o salário que não consegue cobrir com as necessidades da casa.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is married and is the father of 3 children, 2 of whom live in their own homes, and the youngest still goes to school.  He lives in his own house with his family and also supports his nephew by sending him food.

He works as a packer for a company that produces and sells bananas.  With his current loan, he will buy construction materials (stone, a door, cement, sand, iron, etc.), to continue with the construction of his home.

In the future, he wants to finish and furnish his home to improve the comfort of his family.  He plans to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.

His biggest challenge is his salary and that it doesn't cover his home's needs.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (stone, a door, cement, sand, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Olga

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 1 filho que ainda frequenta a Escola. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 irmãos enviando alguns géneros alimentícios. 	
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos diversos, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, ferro, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro pretende melhorar as condições da sua habitação e mobilar o interior da casa para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal tenciona pagar devidamente este empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o custo elevado do material de construção para poder conseguir terminar a sua casa em pouco tempo.
texts.en:
Olga is a single mother of one son who is still in school.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports two of her siblings by sending them food.

She has her own business selling various products.  With her current loan, she will buy construction materials (cement, sand, iron, stone, etc.) to continue with the construction of her home.

In the future, she wants to improve the conditions of her home and furnish the inside to give more comfort to her family.  This is why she plans to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.

Her biggest challenge is the elevated costs of construction materials to be able to finish her house in a short time.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, iron, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Vania

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 1 filho que ainda não frequenta a Escola. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Trabalha como técnica agrária e continua a estudar, com o presente empréstimo pretende pagar a legalização do seu terreno e mais tarde iniciar com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir com os seus estudos e melhorar as condições da sua habitação, para tal tenciona pagar devidamente este empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos de investimento e o elevado custo de vida.
texts.en:
Vania is married and is the mother of one son who is still in school.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else besides them.  She works in agriculture and continues to go to school.  With her current loan, she will pay for the title of her land and later start construction on her home.

In the future, she hopes to finish her education and to improve her living conditions.  She plans to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the lack of investment funds and the elevated cost of living.

loans.use: to pay for the title to her land and to later build a house.

loans.name: Rogerio

texts.es:
Rogerio tiene 57 años, es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, además de amable y cordial. Está separado de la madre de sus 5 hijos, quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de una de sus hijas, a quien quiere mucho y con quien comparte los gastos de su casa.

Su actividad es el servicio de soldadura, mecánica de motos y vulcanizado. Oficios que aprendió estudiando en el centro de adiestramiento industrial y ganó experiencia trabajando como ayudante en un taller de mecánica de motos. Ahora trabaja en su propio taller, el cual instaló en el frontis de su casa. También compra repuestos usados, los repara y los vende a más precio. Se inició en este negocio hace más de 15 años y hasta el momento lo realiza solo. Considera su actividad bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y el poco tiempo que le toma realizarlo. Antes de empezar con su actividad tenía apuros económicos, pero ahora con su propio taller tiene mejores ganancias, con las cuales desea crecer y contratar personal y dedicarse sólo a la administración.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP. Está contento y agradecido de saber que seguirá contando con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores.
Con el monto solicitado, de 3500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de herramientas para su taller, además de una compresora valorizada en 500 dólares y materiales de soldadura.
texts.en:
Rogerio, age 57, is a hardworking and enterprising gentleman. He is also friendly and cordial. Rogerio is separated from the mother of his five children, who are grown and independent. He lives in his own home with one of his daughters, who loves him dearly and shares in the household expenses.

Rogerio provides welding services, as well as motorcycle and tire repairs. He learned these skills by studying at an industrial training center. Rogerio gained experience by working as an assistant at a motorcycle repair shop. Now he works in his own establishment, which is set up in front of his house. He also buys used parts, repairs them, and then sells them at a higher price. Rogerio started his business more than 15 years ago and continues to work by himself to this day. He considers his business to be profitable as a result of the good revenues it generates and the minimal amount of time required to manage it. Before starting this business, Rogerio had financial worries. Now that his workshop is generating more profits, he wants to continue growing and hire employees so that he can focus only on managing the business.

This is his second loan with the MFP organization. He is pleased and grateful to know that he can continue accessing a line of credit for advancing his business. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments in the same manner as his previous loan. The loan amount of 3,500 PEN that he requested will be invested in tools for his workshop. He will also buy a compressor valued at 500 dollars and welding materials.

loans.use: to buy tools, a compressor, and welding materials.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emperatriz Andromeda

texts.es: Emperatriz es socia del Bancomunal Tulipanes, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, es estudiante universitaria, tiene un estudio fotográfico donde es socia junto a sus padres, con el esfuerzo que siempre le puso a su negocio logro ser dueña de un 70% del estudio fotográfico, está muy contenta por todo lo que ha podido realizar. Le gusta mucho pertenecer a la institución porque allí se preocupan de cada una de las socias, se apoyan entre sí, su meta es abrir una tienda de ropa de segunda mano. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para su estudio fotográfico, y para la compra de ropa para toda edad y poder incursionar en el negocio de la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is a member of the Communal Bank "Tulipanes" (Tulips). She is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Emperatriz is a university student, but she also has a photography studio that she co-owns with her parents. As a result of the effort she always puts into her business, she now owns a 70% share of the photography studio. She is very pleased with everything she has accomplished. Emperatriz likes being part of FINCA Peru because the members are concerned for one another and support each other. Her goal is to open a secondhand clothing store.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies for her photography studio and to acquire clothes for all ages so that she can start her clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her photography studio and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dayulis

texts.es:
Dayulis de 22 años de edad se dedica a la venta de refrescos, bebidas frías y pasabocas en general. Ella vive en el municipio de Salgar, lugar ubicado a orillas del mar, donde la playa, brisa, mar y la gente alegre y cordial son parte de la  inigualable cultura en la que habita. Su actividad comercial inició dese hace 3 años,  con un enfriador con el que vendía inicialmente gaseosas, hielo, chicha, bolis etc, posteriormente fue agregando otros productos, como panes y pasabocas y hoy su crecimiento ha sido muy bueno, hasta el punto que  con sus utilidades, ha logrado adquirir otro enfriador, porque unos solo era insuficiente . La mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos del barrio y turistas, que en su camino a la playa, deciden hacer una parada y refrescarse, para calmar la sed, que produce el incidente sol; así ellos disfrutan sus refrescos bajo el frondoso árbol de mango, que rodea la terraza de la casa de Dayulis. 
Como sus compras las realiza cada vez que el proveedor llega en su camión y su clientela ha crecido, muchas veces no tiene productos para la venta, o debe comprarlo a intermediarios que encarecen el precio de ventas; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cervezas, gaseosas, para tener un inventario y no tener que decirle a sus clientes que no hay refrescos o tener   recargar  su precio. Su inversión será exitosa porque tendrá suficiente refrescos para responderle a su clientela, siempre que estos decidan sentarse bajo el frondoso árbol de mango, y tomarse sus refrescos bien fríos y en un aire cálido y saludable como el que produce estar a la orilla del mar.
texts.en: Dayulis is 22 years old and sells beverages, cool drinks and finger food. She lives in the municipality of Salgar, located on the seashore, where the beach, the soft breeze, the sea and the nice and happy people make up a unique culture. She started her business three years ago selling soft drinks, ice, chicha (a cold drink made from maize or fruit), bolis (a traditional form of ice cream found in Colombia), and others out of a cooler. She gradually started offering other products such as bread or finger food. Her business has been growing steadily, allowing her to buy a second cooler, because one was not enough. The majority of her customers are people from the neighbourhood or tourists who, on their way to the beach, choose to stop for refreshments in order to quench the thirst caused by the sun beating down on the earth; thus they happily sip their beverages under the welcome shade of the mango tree that stands on the terrace of Dayulis's house. Since she buys from her supplier only when he comes round in his lorry and her clientele has grown, Dayulis often lacks products to sell, and she has to resort to buying from intermediaries, which makes for a steep mark-up in price. This is why she asks for a Kiva loan, which is her first loan with field partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the funds to buy beer and soft drinks to stock so as not to have to tell clients that she is out of refreshments or be forced to sell at a higher price. Her investment will pay off because she will have enough beverages to meet demand, as long as her customers continue to enjoy their cool drinks under the shade of the mango tree, in the warm, healthy air of the seashore.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks to stock.

loans.name: Khamida

texts.ru:
Хамиде 46 лет, вдова, имеет 5 детей. На протяжении 10 лет, Хамида вместе с покойным мужем занимались изготовлением мебели  и в качестве дополнительного источника –животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки трех гусей. В хозяйстве Хамиды на сегодняшний  день имеется  10 голов мелкого скота, 2 коровы с телятами. Хозяйство и мастерская приносят 8,000 сом (KGS) дохода в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Хамида обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Хамида планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и мастерской мужа.
texts.en:
Khamida is 46 years old, she is a widow and has 5 children.  For 10 years, Khamida with her late husband built furniture and as a source of extra income raised livestock, having started this business by purchasing three geese.  Today, Khamida owns 10 heads of small livestock, and 2 cows with calves.  Her farm and workshop bring in 8,000 somoni (KGS) in income per month.

In order to further grow her business, Khamida has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 somoni (KGS) to purchase additional livestock.  Khamida plans to use the earnings from her loan to further grow the farm and workshop of her husband.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Orlando Enrique

texts.es: Orlando compró 4 lavadoras y ahora está ofreciendo un más oportuno y efectivo servicio y esto fue gracias a su primer credikiva, con el cual se siente muy felíz. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento con el cual comprara una lavadora mas,  pues su demanda ha crecido y en ocasiones sus clientes se van de su negocio, sin recibir el servicio porque todas están ocupadas. La razón de éxito de su credikiva, es que con la inversión en maquinaria, responderá a la demanda de un mercado insatisfecho, que para Orlando es muy conocido y con el que piensa salir adelante cada vez más. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias por el crédito anterior, espero que me continúen apoyando para que mi negocio sea mas rentable y continúe creciendo y sacar adelante a su familia.”
texts.en:
Thanks to his first Kiva loan, Orlando purchased four washing machines. Now he is offering more timely and effective service, which makes him very happy. At the moment, he is applying for a new loan to buy one more washing machine. Demand has increased and sometimes his customers leave his business because they cannot access service when all of his machines are being used. The reason why is Kiva loan was successful is because he used it to invest in machinery, thus allowing him to satisfy the unmet demand in the marketplace.

Orlando is well-known and plans to move forward with each opportunity. His message to the Kiva lenders is as follows: "Thank you for the previous loan. I hope that you will continue to support my business so that it become more profitable in order for me to continue growing and moving ahead with my family."
